We decided to give it a try and the food was made well and they even attempted to make the brew house fries which hands down was the best thing on the menu. Wasn't the same. It was good enough to eat but I'm sad to say I'll be crossing my favorite place off the list for date nights. I'll be voting with my wallet else where. The service was good but I came for the food and I now know what disappointment tastes like.

Long story short. 

Threw the "dirty" rag on the table I was sitting at- to the other table, when walking into the bar seating area.  Waiter saw that and gave me a dirty look. Had 20 minutes until his sexton closed, he gave some girls some stuff and helped them, came to us 5 minutes before shift (yes, 15 minutes passed) and then said here's so menus, I'm leaving. 

Then, we pick what we want and go to bar, he says, "wrong menu". Gave us another one, finally ordered and they delivered. Overall it was okay- not so bad, but not so good. I figured for having table seating it might be a little better than standard bar food, but not that impressed. 

I get the waiter, but just get over it, obviously I wasn't purposely being a jerk, I just didn't see you. 

I also got eye-rolled for smoking and as well as they held their noses, by two "dimbo" girls.  It's a bar, 2AM, get over yourselves. Speaking of them, the crowd was young, too much for me. Can't believe I'm saying that and I'm not even 29, that's both: depressing and pitiful.

The place was nice and chill on a Sunday afternoon, before the Knights game. Started off in the dining room area. I like that the music was low, so our group could have a conversation. I ordered some pretzel bites to start, and a deep dish pepperoni and sausage pizza for lunch. The pretzel bites were great! They were not and buttery, with two sauces. Both the cheese and mustard sauces were really good. The pizza was also good. I do prefer Giordano's deep dish, but this pizza wasn't bad at all. The handcrafted root beer is a star! It's heavier and smoother than bottled stuff, and much less carbonation. I'd come back just for the root beer. After lunch, some of us headed to the bar area to smoke cigars. A nice place to hang out with friends. The employees were nice and very helpful. I'm sure I'll be back!

Great place to come for Happy Hour for their great chicken wings. Their pizza is great too. They have a wide variety of things to choose from on their menu, and offer a  variety of beers also, that they make there. Go and enjoy !

Went here about a month ago, very enjoyable meal.  We shared the Chicago deep dish pizza (excellent) and the garlic knots.  My wife and daughter split the ziti dish and I had a buffalo chicken wrap.  All of the food was very tasty and fresh.  My wife, who is from Chicago, also greatly enjoyed her meal.  The portions are enormous, especially the deep dish pizza.  We had plenty of pizza, garlic knots and ziti to bring home and enjoy for a couple of days after.  The buffalo chicken wrap was also very good and had just enough "zing" to satisfy my spicy food cravings.
      As we had a child with us, we did not check out the bar area, only the restaurant, which is physically seperated into two different rooms to accomodate both families and bar customers.  Overall, I found the Chicago Brewing Company to be a very good find, and would definately recommend giving it a try if you haven't been there already....

After driving by Chicago Brewing Company countless times, I finally decided to stop by for Ken M.'s UYE last week. In short, the company was great, as was the brown ale. I sampled the Oatmeal Raisin Cookie brew... meh... not my thing. I split the wild game sliders with Norm and Tony (6 for $30) and my favorites were the rabbit, wild boar and bison. Honestly, I can't even remember what the others (alligator, antelope, rabbit/antelope mix) tasted like. It was a week ago, afterall.  If you're a fan of sliders, check it out since they're some of the more unique ones you'll find in the area.

We visited June 18th. Of the 3 breweries I sampled in Vegas, Chicago Brewing had the best beer. The IPA was outstanding, not overly hoppy and lovely citrus overtones. I also thought the atmosphere and food was excellent to very good. I really enjoyed sitting in the cigar lounge overlooking the casino floor as hubby did a little gambling and I did a little drinking and people watching (no I don't smoke, but smoke smell was not overly offensive). We had an excellent pizza for dinner, husband enjoyed a root beer. Sure wished we would have ordered the garlic knots as suggested in the other reviews, especially regretted it when the table next door got an order...they smelled divine and I overheard them raving about them...but by then we were full and ready to move on. I would have given CBC 4 and a half stars if it were possible. Service was good and I wanted a beer w/ souvenir glass and they did not have them, so the guy tried to get me to buy some $15 glass, minor stuff.

I'm a Chicagoan who frequented Lou Malnati's, Giordano's, etc. all my life. CBC's deep dish leaves nothing to be desired. In fact, I enjoy the rich dough / crust even more. 

Vegas recently got a Giordano's, but I will be hitting up CBC for deep dish. It's less costly and as a local now, I hate going to the strip just to eat. 

The kicker is that there is cigar-friendly section. For non-smokers, the main restaurant section is smoke free.  The humidor is decently stocked. Prices range a bit, but one of my fav smokes (CAO Brazilia) was in stock and sold at a fair price  of $7.

We were in tonight for dinner. We sat in The dining room because the bars were both full. It was football Sunday at the the end of the season so that is to be expected. Our server was really attentive and rocked it. She checked on us often but wasn't annoying about it even though the dining room was empty. 
We started with the steak sauce fries which were absolutely yummy. I would definitely suggest them to anyone coming in. After eating those I was expecting our sandwiches to be just as amazing and they just missed the mark completely. I had the NY steak sandwich. The garlic aioli sauce on it was the only thing that saved it. The French bread was really soggy, the steak itself had no flavor. It could've at least had some salt and pepper on it. 
Overall the food was good but with BJs and Claimjumpers so close in distance I was hoping for better food for the price. I will stick to the other two instead and possibly stop in to pick up those fries again.
Service was terrible, be aware that it's a cigar place, so it reeks of cigar smoke and the food was only ok.  The waiter didn't even bother coming back to see if we wanted a second beer.

Excellent little place inside the 4 queens casino, had the garlic knots and filet mignon sliders for appetizers with a wheat beer that was a great start for the delicious deep dish pizza filled with pepperoni and sausage!!! Must visit for any deep dish pizza or regular pizza fan!

The happy hour appetizer menu is a joke, good in the way of drinks but a joke for food. On the menu is personal pan cheese pizza , garlic knots , and pretzel bites. The pizza was thin crust and $5 you are better off going to little Caesar's. It was OK but so small and thin the $5 just didn't seem well spent. The pretzel bites came with  weird tasting cheese; me and my friends couldn't figure out if it was just some weird pasteurized melted cheese or plain bad. We avoided dipping pretzels bites in it and opted for ranch/mustard instead. The garlic knots were much better and very big, they were actually the best thing on the menu. The sangria was also pretty good and I believe only $5-6 it came in a big glass as well with fresh fruit; delicious!!!! Will be back for the drink happy hour, it was worth it, but my advice is eat before you come otherwise prepare for dissapointment.
What a nice surprise!  Their Cod Fish entree served with cole slaw is wonderful.  This is a great restaurant to visit over and over again.

My beer was amazing!!!! The taste was great!!! The atmosphere was fun!!! We had a group of 15 and they were very accommodating!! We love pizza so it was really gonna challenge us to go outside our own pizza box!!! We would have loved to get a big deep dish pizza but they only serve it in 9"!! Kind of a downfall:( we ordered a large meat pizza, thin crust!! Let me tell you it was superb!!! Sauce was just right, the amount of cheese was perfect!!!! And the wait staff was excellent!!! Definitely two thumbs up!!!!!!

Great looking brewery from the outside and inside. Went for their graveyard happy hour and was extremely impressed with both the micro brews and the price points of $2.50 for a 22oz :0. Great service even though they were slammed. Awesome all the way around.

charlie may have been one of the best bartenders i have ever had. his attention to detail efficiency was spectacular.

the food is amazing, the beers are delicious and the service by charlie was stellar.

I took my sister out for dinner here. This place is awesome! We had Teriyaki wings and deep dish chicken Alfredo pizza soo delicious!! Loved the beer sampler as well! When I come back to Vegas def coming back!
Excellent beer. And the deep dish Chicago pizza is great., robust sauce and big. My wife had the Caesar salad wrap and she says it was quite good .
Great service.  Ashley was so nice and explained the menu items. The garlic knots are super good. Great place. Can't beat it!

Only in Vegas does one have to walk through a poorly ventilated casino and into a little cigar bar to get a craft beer.

We had a special deal in our Yelp Spring Break book for a $2.50 beer here which lured us in.  I went for a mango wheat (because wheat beer is pretty awesome and mangos are super awesome) only to find out they had switched it out for blueberry vanilla or some such thing.  Obviously better that your typical Bud Light/Heineken typically found in Vegas, but it tasted a bit like an air freshener.

It really wouldn't be a bad place to hang if it weren't for the cigar bar aspect, but we could only really handle it for a few minutes before we took our beers to go and lost some money in the slot machines.

We were told this place was amazing. I think amazing might be a bit of a stretch.
Good food, at a great price. Absolutely! But that is about it.

The beer drinkers at the table loved the selection of beers.
Maybe that is the secret? Go to get drunk and have good pizza?

Had a good night out at Chicago Brewing a couple of weeks ago.  Server was quite friendly and fast.

Pluses, service and the food, very good.  

Super pluses!!! Old Town Brown Ale!  Great tasting craft beer and great price $6 for 22 ounces.  

Minus, only one.  You can sometime smell the smoke from the bar in the dining room.  

Other than that, A OK

Cool spot. Hipster looking lol. More of a restaurant vibe than brewery. Their selection was decent. Light tasting ipa and the typical stout to pilsner list. Bar tender not as attentive but she was aight. 2 stories seems like it could be popping but it was kinda dead at 8pm sat

We ordered the garlic knots and a 9 inch deep dish pizza. The garlic knots were decent, the pizza though was less than impressive.

Great list of beers at least.

Service here was EXTREMELY slow. All the other tables had at least 4 people so again I think we were viewed as the least important table. Our server was never apologetic for the waiting either. Just about scrapes 3 stars, we definitely wouldn't return.
Never eaten here but the beer is some of the best. The Saison is to die for!

I ate dinner here while in town for a youth hockey tournament.  It was a brewery within walking distance of the hotel.  I thought it was a perfect match.  However, the place allows smoking.  I would have given them four stars if they were smoke free.  

I realize this is a Las Vegas thing, but it ruined my apatite.  They do have outdoor seating.  We asked to sit out there.  Our waitress came back and said a large group had used all of the propane the night before.  I am not sure if I believe that.

I ate a small thin crust pizza.  It was OK.  My wife had a huge salad.  She said it was OK.  I bet both would have tasted better if we weren't passively breathing in second hand smoke.

The beer was good.  I had the house brown ale and the IPA.  I would have had another if the place was smoke free.
Great crispy wings, pizza and filet mignon sliders, highly recommend! Only down side is all the smoke! It is a cigar bar after all. Prices are fair too
This place has a nice outdoor lounge area. Their happy hour specials are pretty great too. 4pm-7pm they have half off house drafts and some great deals on appetizers. I plan on coming back!
Not bad. Their happy hour goes pretty late. I would recommend their large pan crust BBQ chicken pizza. Yum!
Try the chili cheese fries for an app!!  Huuuge portions.  The beef dip sandwich is  a fav lunch item.

It was a slow day, the waitress was good. The beer was actually really good, I'm not a huge IPA fan so I usually get the lightest IPA. The happy hour deals are great prices and the food is good and came out quick. I'd definitely go back to this place.

Great service. We sat at the rail and received excellent service from three different bartenders. They were all working in synchronized harmony making sure that we we're well taken care of.

The Beer: we got the sampler which had 9 tastes for only $8! The IPA was almost perfect for me, floral flavors with lots of hops :) The seasonal was a vanilla blueberry heffeweizen, which was just so uniquely tasty. I thought it would be too sweet for me but it was a perfectly refreshing summer beer.

The Food: the garlic chicken pizza was very flavorful and just the right size for yourself or for two if you shared it with a salad, which we did. The salad was just simple field greens with tomatoes and onions. It was just good enough.

Overall I was just so happy to find good craft beer, brewed in Vegas. Everything else were great surprise bonuses. Can't wait to come back ;)

So this time around my husband and I came here because he was looking for a cigar lounge on Fremont Street. He visited this place twice during our trip and had a great experience both times. When I came with him during one of his visits, we were greeted with a friendly waitress. We ordered drinks and pizza and watched the game, which was nice. There is not much of a menu, your normal bar food, but if you are looking for a nice chicago style deep dish pizza, come here and check it out.
Just to note: there are 2 sides to this place- the cigar lounge and the restaurant, so you can choose either side. 
Our bill for 4 drinks and the pizza was 36, which is good for Vegas. The only thing that complicated things with our visit was that the waitress got quite busy at times and so it took a while to get our check, but that was okay!

A hidden gem! The rambling wreck is the best beer in Vegas. I got the giant souvenir glass, which is an alcoholic's wet dream. Thin crust pizza was very tasty. Only complaint, for a cigar friendly bar, the ventilation was bad on the couches. Will be back next time, won't waste any more time at triple 7, this is the real deal!

I like the Filet Mignon sliders, garlic knots and the thin crust pizza.  They are really good.  My complaint would be: I think it's too expensive for the kind of food.  $11 for three sliders!  Maybe I could see it if they piled the meat on them, but they don't.  Just one very thin layer of meat.  $14 for a pitcher of beer! 

I make it a point to go during "happy hour". The appetisers are half price then. Also you can use your 4 Queens players card and get money off the bill (if you have any comps due).

I also feel the service here is painfully slow.

In a word disappointing. First the good stuff: beer isn't bad and very inexpensive; the staff is very nice and extremely friendly; cool looking interior and the dining area looks clean and newer.  The rest is bad: food is awful, extremely salty and over cooked equivalent to cheap pub food just with a bigger price tag (I didn't have the pizza though, perhaps that is good); the bathrooms were filthy which always makes me question what the kitchen might look like.  Only recommend if you are hankering for cheap bar food and drinks but you would really prefer to pay more for it.

I'm a regular at Chicago's - we usually dine here on Friday or Saturday nights on an almost weekly basis.  We like it because it's only about 10 min from our house and the food is consistent.

We order mostly the same things (not all at one time of course) .. LOL
Brew BQ Burger, Sliders (Black and Bleu and Chicken Cordon Bleu), Deep Dish pizza, Steak Fries appetizer, Steamed Clams, French Onion Soup, Clam Chowder.  On occasion - I'll order the Philly cheesesteak and although it's not a replacement for a real cheesesteak - it is a pretty good sandwich.

One thing that I really like about this place is that the waitstaff doesn't turn over often - so if you are a regular like us, you know that you are going to get decent, cordial, consistent service.

Although we aren't big drinkers - you can't beat their beer prices.  I'm a fan of the stout beer and for $4 - it's a really great deal.

Chicago's is not a trendy place nor is it a dive - but you'll get a consistent, reasonably priced meal every time you go.

Although I live right across the street from this place, I don't eat there often.  This time I enjoyed it.  The baked ziti deep dish was a treat!  They take ziti, mozzarella, parmesan and fine marinara sauce and bake it right in to a deep dish pizza crust!  Fantastic.  The salad was good.  I got a beer but found it too warm.  I asked the server to make it colder so she brought a frozen mug to pour it in.  Didn't help much.  For $4 I would have preferred her bringing me a newer colder one.

They open at 11:30, but it was 11:34 before they opened up. Not a huge deal, just a pet peeve. We went to sit at a table and it was still dirty from the night before, but the waiter quickly wiped it down (and he also later wiped down the other tables in the dining room).
We ordered the garlic knots and the 9" deep dish pepperoni. We're from Illinois but have lived in Denver for the last year where the pizza is terrible so we were looking forward to good pizza.
First, the garlic knots are a great value. I think we got about 7 of them for $4.99. They're large knots too. They're more on the flaky side vs. Chewy. Good though.
The deep dish was also quite good. It's no Gino's East, but still good. The sauce isn't quite as chunky as you'd find in Chicago, but frankly, I prefer a smoother sauce. Server did a good job and was friendly and prompt with refills. 
Overall, I'd definitely come back again.

Things that have brought me great disappointment:

1. The Minnesota Vikings 
2. The discovery there is no Santa Claus
3. The quality of the beer at Chicago Brewing Company

Las Vegas lacks a brew pub with great beer, great food, and fun atmosphere. (Big Dogs comes close, but not quite.)  Chicago Brewing Company offers okay food coupled with mediocre beer.  The cavernous (and usually empty) dining room gives off a forlorn vibe.  Combine this with the quality of the beer and you have the epitome of depression right on Sahara Avenue.

What can Chicago Brewing Company do to save itself?

1. Start brewing truly original (and tasty) beer.  They are a prime example of how microbrew doesn't always mean good.  For example:  A porter should have a hint of roasted coffee aroma, not taste like someone's excrement after a trip to Starbuck's.
2. Expand upon the more creative options on the food menu.
3. Rearrange the dining area to make it more intimate and less "cavern of doom."

Until then, I will wait for someone to open a great brew pub in Vegas.  However, I won't hold my breath.

Had a great lunch! Appetizers were fabulous drinks were awesome, and service was amazing! Our server Ronika was very informative, upbeat, and quick. She delivered  exceptional  customer service. Just move into town from SoCal and this was the best customer service I have experienced since arriving in Las Vegas. We will defeat be coming back.

My favorites eats were the garlic knots the deep dish pizza (magnificent meat lovers), and the spinach artichoke dip. Also enjoyed the house beers very delish.

Been coming here since the day it opened. Had employee Christmas parties here. Many long drinking/ gambling nights. The big catch is how nice and endearing the staff is to regulars. But also love that they are not afraid to send people home when they are acting up. You definitely get that "Cheers" vibe. Continued success. Oh btw just found out they started brewing their own Nitro coffee from beans roasted down the street at Desert Wind Roasters. Great companies support other local businesses. Whohoo!!

I came here last Friday night while I was in Vegas to hang out with my brother and my best friend...we came at around 11:30 just for a few appetizers and beer. I was surprised it wasn't busier, but it was good - there were only a few other groups in the bar area. My brother and friend liked the beer selection, I didn't really pay attention as I'm not a huge beer drinker. Service was average at best - our server checked on us maybe once after he brought our food and just seemed kind of aloof. My friend ordered wings which were DELICIOUS, but I had the chili fries - they came with tons of cheese as well as this creamy beer cheese, which was all right but it was just way too much cheese. They should do one or the other. The chili on it was good but we couldn't eat very many of them. (They were cheap though - I $9 for a HUGE plate.)

I did like the feel and atmosphere of the bar and I'm going to give it another shot when I'm back in Vegas and in more of a drinking mood. Maybe if I'm drunk next time I'll love the chili fries.
Wonderful service and wonderful pizza! The apps are reasonably priced! Love the atmosphere!

Chicago style deepdish was great. I don't know how true to the original their pizza is as I have never been to Chicago, but I thought it tasted fantastic. What an unlikely place to find it too. The beer was quite nice. I have had quite a few IPAs and consider myself somewhat of an aficionado and theirs definitely stood out.  Deff

This place is just decent. Place was packed, which shocked me. We were able to find a table (connected to others) and our waiter took forever- poor thing was the only one running around like a chicken with his head cut off. He was really nice though. Food was decent- they forgot our potato skins which was the reason we were there LOL! The manager ended up comping our sodas which again, was really nice. This place may be better during off times...

This used to be a good place 1 year ago, but I guess all those people are gone now. Today they have an Asian/filipina hostess she was rude. The pizza is not the same the taste is not the same. Thank god I only spend 15$ here.

 please stay away.

Hate to say it but the beers here are mediocre.
I have liked their Fremont St. location due to proximity to downtown activities and casinos, but find this place lacking and their beers tasting like average craft beer from the late 1990's to perhaps early 2000's. The brewery scene in Las Vegas has improved, but Chicago Brewing hasn't.
Nothing very interesting or crisp tasting, with the usual "pale, amber, brown, stout", and a weak IPA core lineup. Seasonals were a steam beer, blueberry vanilla ale, and golden ale with lime and none were really any good.
Service was decent, location easy to get to and a little dated on dcor but passable. Food was just OK.

So far, the best place I've been to in Las Vegas for craft beers in a brewpub.
Lower original gravity=less taste, and most places are mailing in their versions of different styles on the lower end of the ranges. The beers here are more true to style, with more taste. 
I'll admit that I'm spoiled living in the Pacific NW, so the brewpubs in LV wouldn't last long there, but are still a major step above BMC beers.
Chicago Brewing's amber is solid, their pale is solid, their IPA is good but not overpowering with bitterness. Had a great weizenbock seasonal here once too. Generally good beers.
The pub overlooks the 4 Queens casino, and has a cigar case. Smoking and non smoking areas since they expanded.
Very good service, very nice and friendly servers who take good care of you while there. 
The pizza is good, and the other food on the menu is better than average bar fare.
Worth checking out if you want something more than Bud, Miller, or Heineken for beers while visiting Las Vegas.

I stayed at the Four Queens and there was a coupon for buy one get one free beer and we went to try it out. The beer was good. The place was nice and cozy. The food menu looked good and it was reasonable priced. The staff was very nice and friendly, even gave me a miniature draft as I was cashing out.
Beer Hot !! 101%. Chicago 9' Pizza +\-  but service guy... Terrific this men never smile for  a second. Bad experience sorry.  My friend send me to this place. Never back a gain.

I've been here many times. Primarily because it's the closest bar to where I live.

If you're a member of the younger crowd 21-35 you'll probably love this place. If you're looking for a quite place to get away and have a drink this is not the place.

Friday and Saturday nights, as well as many evenings, the place is so packed it's hard to find a spot at the bar.

You'll find a lot of kids yelling and screaming acting as if it's the first time they've ever had a drink.

As for there food I've tried most everything on the menu and every time it's been a disappointment.

The staff is usually very friendly and attentive.

So although I go here on a regular basis I wouldn't give it high marks. But like I said if you're younger and want to hang out with a louder crowd you'll probably enjoy this place.

Best deep dish pizza I have ever had! And if I were to have a last meal on earth.... the chicken wings, a deep dish pizza, and a 22oz glass of the "All Nighter" beer would be it!

Our family has been coming here as part of our Thanksgiving tradition for over 10 years! This hidden gem is located in the 4 Queens hotel. It is located upstairs near the Golden Nugget side of the casino. They have a bar area with about 15 seats at the bar, and then about 5 high top round table that seat 4-8 people. They also have a cigar lounge with couches to sit on while smoking your stogie.

The chicken wings come in an order of 10. They have various sauces but we usually stick with the mild buffalo sauce. Very tasty!! The star of this place, in my opinion, is the deep dish pizza. It comes in a small personal pan, split into 4 pieces. Don't let the size fool you. This pizza is smothered in cheese, on top of a light, but doughy thick crust. The pizza also comes with sausage and pepperoni embedded into the cheese. I once ate the whole thing, and then slipped into a food coma! lol! My Fiancee and I split one pizza, and sometimes have one slice left over. 

This place is also part of a brewery. The serve their own craft beers ranging from a light pilsner, to an amber ale, an IPA, and a stout. I have had the pilsner and amber ale and thoroughly enjoy them. 

If I were ever to stand by a 5 star rating this is the one! The service is fantastic! The pizza is fantastic! The wings are fantastic! And the fact that it is still a hidden gem is fantastic!
Still 5 stars for us! Here on St Patrick's day with our awesome server DAMIEN!! Thanks so much!

Great Place!! I felt at sweet home here thanks to the bartenders!  The Italian Beef was EXCELLENT!!   Add some Provolone and you're in heaven.  My BF got the BBQ Bacon Burger and also loved it. It was huge.  The beer was great too.

Since this is a brewing company, I had to try the beer. The best way I thought was to go with the sampler... It comes with 9 (i'm not sure, I stopped counting after the first buzz kicked in!).. 

Out of the beers, I enjoyed the seasonal beer which was the blueberry vanilla. Guess it's cause I like fruity. I don't usually like dark brews but I enjoyed the black star stout. Had a very yummy coffee taste to it. The other beers I didn't really care for.. and actually some had a really really bitter to it. (Yes, I know beer is suppose to taste bitter but I didn't care for these). 

The food was good. Nothing I'd actually really crave again. The chili cheese fries were good.. reminded me of an upgrade weinersnitchel  chili cheese fries. I liked that they used thin fries instead of a thick cut. 

I don't like blue cheese but it went well with my sliders. The carmelized onions added a nice sweetness to it...

And there you have it, my review of chicago brewing company.

This is for the Irish nachos.. Gross!! Mixing cheese sauce with shredded cheese is disgusting!! Just use cheddar people! The beer selection was great and tasted really good. Next time we come back we will do without the nachos

Moved in across the road.  Server was a bit of a lingerer for my liking.  Ordered the chicken tenders, they were very nice, just need to be drained more as they sitting in oil which was unappetizing.  Pizzas were ok, however one base was on the over cooked side and was under cooked.

My memories of Chicago are probably like everyone else's...mooning an umpire at a White Sox game. Like most people I have interfered with a potential playoff home run baseball, rode the back of Bill Cartwright, never ate at anything Michael Jordan owned, threw up deep dish pizza in a drunken haze, and snagging some cheap chick from Tinley Park in the bathroom of Exedus II. (We all know they are the easiest chicks in the Metro area...gotta love the nave suburbs.)  You know, the usual things any one does in Chicago.

All of those good memories came flooding back to me when I passed the Chicago Brewing Company. A wave of emotions hit me...I almost hit my hearse into a bus full of nuns...almost reliving another Chicago memory I have tried to hard to forget. The smell of burning Habit is really oft putting and not one you forget easily...but I digress...
I sauntered into the bar a few months ago ready to smash any of those Chicago loving goons for just looking at me wrong, and what I found was a really nice place to eat, a great bar and some good food.
First, the downstairs dining room.  Sometimes your old pal Rex has a hard time getting up and down stairs. That damn keyboard cleaner really throws off your balance when you huff two cans.  So, I decided to eat where it was most convenient.  The one legged hooker with dysentery appreciated it...all that shaking from the hoping up the stairs can produce some horrible results.   She got a chicken sandwich with hot sauce and I got a cobb salad, a corn cob screwed up my partial plate. Remember kids...always brush at least once a week, I wish my 6 foster mothers told me that instead of what a loser I was.  Anyway...the cob salad is gigantic. It is a great salad. Chicken, bacon, avocado, egg, you name it. All fresh, all well seasoned and all very good.  Jasmine, if that was her real name, told me the sandwich was very hot, I wouldn't touch anything she touched but next time I tried it and I thought it was excellent. Big piece of chicken fried and covered with hot sauce.  There could have been more sauce because the bun was a little dry.  I ate several times down there and all the food was good, the waitress service was great and I never had a time where I wanted to start slicing up the booth with my steak knife. A good sign. The food was always good, but nothing they did was ever great other than the salad...wondering about the pizza...keep reading...

The bar upstairs is where things get fun.  There are a few tv's, some high top tables and chairs and a great little lounge area.  Good times on the weekend if you like the yuppie crowd. Rex doesn't. Perfect for discussing what is easily the best part of this place...the beer. Ah, the beer. They brew their own beer and it is good.  Despite burning my tongue on a tailpipe...don't ask...I could taste all the hoppy goodness.  They have a pale ale and go always up to a nice dark beer. Fruit beers, the blueberry one I tried, was good but not great, other than that they were damn good brews.

Rex will end this on a bad note, just like his 4 marriages, 8 colleges, 19 stops in state run facilities and the one time he met Kyle Petty.  The deep dish pizza sucks! Not just by deep dish pizza standards...but by pizza standards.  The crust is buttery, but after that it falls apart. It is not filled enough with toppings and cheese. It is a chinsy deep dish pizza.  Most medium deep dishes are about 8lbs, sometimes more. This is like 4. They need to add more to it and make it a more substantial pie.  I was disgusted. I threw mine over the balcony and screamed down from the bar "Al Capone should have killed all you sewer rats." Strangely they got upset by this. I am not sure I am allowed back.  I am not sure I care.

Rex Marvin leads. You follow.
Great experience good food great beer the garlic knots are the best ... Kimmie was the best server we have had in years..

My family really likes this place. The outdoor seating is wonderful, especially with a young child. The happy hour specials are great, and can be utilized outside. I enjoy the food, the beers, and the pizza is a nice replacement for almost the real Chicago deal. The service is top notch.I am looking forward to the cooler weather, to enjoy lazy weekends on the patio, watching sports and enjoying the amazing food and service.

I really enjoy this place as well as it's satellite location in the Four queens Hotel on Fremont. The beers are well made and tasty. Service has always been friendly and efficient when I have visited.
The pizza both deep dish and tavern style are tasty hot and fresh, not great mind you but tasty. The Garlic Knots here are outrageous, they are so damn good. I've also had the sliders with ghost pepper sauce and they too are quite tasty.
This is definitely worth a stop in, if you are in the neighborhood. Good Beer, Good food, and good fun!!!!
Also they have a smoking deal, get a 50oz beer for $15.00 and you keep the glass, and refills are $5.00. Well worth it

Tasty Beers ina nice intimate atmosphere CHECK! AWESOME PIZZA, CHECK! GARLIC KNOTS TO DIE FOR, CHECK!!!!! 

The IPA here is one of the best in Vegas, it is well balanced with a wonderful hop aroma, and a nice hoppy finish!! The Heffe is also a very nice true to style Bavarian Heffe with hints of bubblegum and clove, and that twinge of banana in the finish.

I prefer the thin crust pie with buffalo Mozz on it, delicious!!! 

This is a sattelite location, and no brewing is done on site, but if you are down on fremont, and looking for a tasty adult Beverage, and some good greasy grub, this is your kind of place MERICA!!!

I have been craving Chicago style pizza for a long while and for my 4 year work anniversary at Zappos, my co-workers took me to this place to celebrate.

It's a small venue, I like that it is split where you can smoke cigars on one side and non smoking on the other. 

We sat and in a very short time later, Bob, our amazing server was there to greet us and grab our drink orders.

I would recommend this place to anyone who is in the Fremont area! 

The Chicago style pizza was just what I wanted. The sauce is delicious, the mozzarella cheese oozes when you pull a slice, I love that!

The Filet Mignon sliders are amazing, you can literally cut into it with a fork, that's how tender they are!

I wasn't a fan of the chicken wings, they were over cooked and dry, so I wouldn't recommend ordering that.

The calamari & the quesadilla was alright, it doesn't really stand out. 

The customer service is amazing, request for Bob to help you out, the atmosphere is great, stop in and have fun and enjoy some good food!

This is as close to Chicago as I'll get for now.  Such a grand theme outside and in.  I like the look.  I also like how they have tall cushioned booth seating.  It sorta keeps meal conversations with some privacy, although the ceilings are super high.  The brick walls are cool!

Yes Florence dear... Double tiered beer sampler and it turns like a carousel.  So neat :)  good flavor variety with their beer menu.  Guess which we liked?  And it's not wimpy just cuz they're not dark.  We prefer the fruity beers.  Except however, the one that literally tasted like coffee (shoot oh forgot the name).

Ooooh MUST TRY their prosciutto wrapped skewers!  I enjoyed it with the horseradish.  Yeah I like horseradish don't snicker at me... Ppptthhh.  I woulda if I coulda ordered anotha...

But we had pizza to work on.  Deep dish margarita pizza with chicken.  Delicious for sure.  The deep pan crust was its own - not my chalky dough type of preference.  It was good though.

Place is good for any reason to have pizza with anywhobees you want company with.  This includes young kids who like to repeat "mom mom mom mom mom" until the parent pays attention (not with our party).  Have a slice of pizza and chug a beer!  Not for the kid...
This is such a gem! Pizza is fantastic, service is amazing, and it's fun to watch the casino floor! Did I mention the pizza was fantastic?

Sitting here watching basketball and enjoying the decor. The staff is very helpful, and accessible, but don't feel the need to check on you every three minutes. Our waiter Billy is was good, and the manager seemed nice too. 

The food was stellar. Our group had pulled pork sliders, pulled pork mac n cheese, a miracle mile meat pizza and the pretzel bites. The sliders weren't spectacular, but certainly above average. The pretzel bites themselves weren't anything special, BUT, the dipping sauces (cheese and mustard) wwre AMAZING.
We had a thin crust pizza, and it was great.  Crust still had a little chewyness to it, and didn't seem like it was made on crackers like many thin crusts.

The root beer was really good (I think they make that in house too). I only had the Weizenheimer Bavarian wheat from the beer list, and as a wheat fan I have to say it was pretty good.

This was our first time here, but it certainly won't be our last.

I love this place. Used to live around the corner and would bring the kids for dinner. I think it's the best pizza. But it has to do with lots of great memories with family and friends. I'd get the 22oz Hef and the fat meat lovers pan pizza. The dough is great.  Just chewy enough with a hint of sweetness.  The wings were great too. Great times, great memories. This place is a winner in my book.

Service: Pretty darn good.
Atmosphere: I like it.

Food: Overall, I like it. My four-stars is based on my overall opinion of the place. I have been here a bunch of times, but I haven't really checked in or reviewed it, so my notes here may make it look worse than my actual opinion. I will have to make more notes as I eat here again to round out my review, but for now, I am just reviewing tonight's meal.

Cheese steak: not so great. Not bad as a roast-beef sandwich, I guess, but not what I am looking for in a cheese steak. The meat is thinly sliced, but chewy. Shouldn't have mushrooms (in my opinion, but I wanted to try their version in the format it was offered). And the beer-cheese was okay, but not really what you want in a cheese-steak sandwich. Pass.

Burger: hubby says good.

Onion rings: at least they get the onions cooked all the way through, but the batter feels heavy with grease. Pass.

Macaroni salad: Not the worst I've had. I little too sweet, and it does have that metallic tang that so many mac salads have, although it is faint. I don't know why that flavor is there, but it's not good. Pass.

In my search for local brewed beer I was led here to Chicago Brewing Company. Chicago is one of the bigger breweries in the Las Vegas scene and pretty much anyone into craft beer has been or heard of this place. My review really just applies to happy hour so keep that in mind.

CBC features several standard beers along with a few rotating seasonal. The hefe, IPA, brown, stout and some others comprise the regular beers, keep an eye out for the Hawaiian Honey with an astounding 14% ABV. My personal favorite, the Hefe is true to it's German roots with a crisp wheat taste and golden color. Service is hit or miss during happy hour and may have to wave down a bartender to get your order in. 

Happy hour is M-F 3pm-7pm in either the upstairs or downstairs bars. I was a little disappointed that there is no late night happy hour which probably explains why this place is a ghost town after 8pm. They offer up $6 pitchers along with $2 14oz and $2.50 22oz. Great prices on awesome beer you can't get anywhere else in town. CBC is pretty weak on the food offerings, $6 for chicken fingers, a cheese pizza and garlic knots. Meh. The upstairs bar doubles as a cigar lounge so if second hand smoke isn't your thing, stay away.

Wow I wish we had come here early in our trip to Vegas, I had read about it but didn't go until our last night. This is a hidden gem at the back or the 4 Queens casino on Fremont st with excellent craft beer and tasty appys, and because it was happy hour (3pm - 6pm) they were half price, as well the beer $3 for a 14oz during happy hour. I would highly recommend the filet mignons sliders, generous helping of caramelized onions, and sauted mushrooms. If all that wasn't enough the staff was very friendly and very passionate about beer. 
  My wife and I will definitely be back here on our next trip.

Chicago Brewing Company deserves two separate reviews - 1 for the beer and 1 for the food.

The beer was surprisingly good.  When restaurants also have an extensive menu, I am usually a little apprehensive about the quality of the beer.  However, the IPA at Chicago Brewing Company was rather good.  I tried a sampler and the Belgian was a little above average, the IPA was very good, and the rest were as anticipated.  

The food was pub food catered to a Chicago audience.  We had a deep dish pizza which wasn't too bad, as well as a baked pasta, nachos, and wings.  The wings could have been spicier but tasted solid nonetheless. 

I heard they had some football specials so if you happen to swing by on a Sunday, try the IPA and maybe the wings or pizza.

A limited but good beer selection.  Since I collect pint glasses and brewery tee shirts, I had to give Chicago Beer Company a try.  My husband is a wine lover, we were happy to see that they had his wine of choice!Since it is located in the Four Queens Casino, I was happy to see that smoking and non-smoking sections were in two separate sections.  The bartenders were helpful and knowledgeable when advising me on beer choices!  I am glad that I gave it a try!

Went in for some food on a Thursday night at 7pm. I should have taken it as a bad sign when there were only 3 other tables with people at them. I ordered the black and blue sliders which were about the most disgusting hamburgers Ive ever eaten in my life. Burger was overcooked the caramelized onion was actually so caramelized it was now candied onion. The whole mess was completely inedible. I just paid and left 2 of 3 sliders sitting on the plate. Do not come here for the food.  The rootbeer and service were actually pretty good but the food was about the worst thing Ive ever eaten in my life.

My boyfriend (who's from Chicago) & I came here from Santa Barbara (we were visiting Vegas) to watch his Chicago Blackhawks vs. New Jersey Devils & it was such an awesome experience!  We ordered the Tower of Beer sampler, garlic knots, & deep dish pizza.  Everything was great!  From the food to the wait staff, it was such a laidback atmosphere. To top it all off, the Chicago Blackhawks won & went on to win the Stanley Cup!  My boyfriend was so happy lol.

This place is crazy cheap and it is 24 hours!  I rarely come out to bars but this is a pretty nice bar that isn't too sketch and has plenty of sitting space.  I hate when I have to stand the whole night waiting for a stool.  This place has plenty of tables downstairs and lots of couches and seats upstairs too.  Definitely a good spot to hang out.  Fireball shots are only $6 each!  Cost-effective if you ask me.

I came here for a quick cheap lunch (fuel)....
I left with a T-shirt and a to-go cup of Stout.

The ambience lacks pizazz, but we sat at the casino-view table for prime people- watching (the joint is elevated a little bit above the casino so the view is good).

The sandwich wrap I had was decent, and huge enough to share.
Our servier was friendly and quick.

Try the beer flight...it's a great deal, and this place actually brews some fairley decent brew.  

FYI
There's a cigar bar attached to it, so you might wanna sniff before you sit.

Chicago Brewing Company... Wow I'm not really sure what happened to this place... Years ago they had amazing food and amazing service now I refuse to go because the service is terrible and the food is even worse the atmosphere in this place isn't even good anymore

Beer was good ....  that's about it.   
We went during happy hour , to try out their own beer brews and have a little food.  My wife and i were looking for new and were HOPING this place would be good.   We were unhappy. 

We got the chips and salsa , it came with some sort of cheese sauce.  Kinda tasted like that stuff you get in a glass jar ( tostitos ? ) from the grocery store. 

I ordered a steak sandwich with onion rings.  I think i got 5 onion rings ... not worth the upcharge , the steak sandwich was good however , it was literally a whole steak thrown on a peice of bread .....  Anytime i have ever had a steak sandwhich before .. they usually slice it at least.   

My wife ordered a ruben ... the waitress brought out my sandwhich and basically told us my wife would have to wait for hers since another waitress took her food on accident . ...  dont they put tickets next to the food for this exact reason ?  It took nearly another 15 minutes. By the time she got her food , mine was almost cold as i didnt want to eat and make my wife sit there while i was eating. 

We did get an apology out of the waitress , but thats it.   I dont think i expect free food or discounts for everything , but there are certain things that you would want to take care of your customers with , and this was it. 

Im sorry but first impression like this is hard to break .. will not be back.

Tucked in the Queens hotel on Fremont st. The pizza was just okay! It wasn't nearly close to anything I've ever had, but it isn't terrible either. The fries here though, are addicting!! The service was also great, which always makes things more pleasant. The ambience here is a bit dark. You can see the Queens casino floor from inside the restaurant, which you'll also have to walk through for the restroom bc the restaurant does not have their own. This is also a cigar bar it looked like. They had cigars in the cases and the bar had gambling machines as well! Wouldn't see myself here again unless I'm starving and walking through Fremont St.

I've visited Chicago Brewing Co. various times for business lunches, nighttime drinks at the bar area, and even for a group fantasy hockey draft event. The service in this place is superb. The food is quite good as well and I believe they offer daily lunch specials. So far I have had both the pozole soup/pizza combo and the fish and chips (each lunch special was $10). The soup was very good, pizza was cooked well, and the fish and chips were spot on but the portion size left a bit to be desired. The craft beers here are extraordinary. You'd be hard pressed to find one you didn't enjoy! From pale ales to IPAs to blonde ales, they typically have the perfect beverage for any pallet. Boasting upstairs and downstairs bar areas to enjoy these custom brews in addition to a cigar smoking area with cigars readily available for purchase, makes Chicago Brewing Company one of the coolest spots to hit for a night out away from the strip.
Excellent food and service. Love the deep dish and beer selection.

Good food, great beer prices, and cozy atmosphere.

Food-Good, but nothing special. We ordered 6 sliders...3 Black n Blue and 3 Filet Mignon, plus a order of their steakhouse fries. Black n Blue had more flavor in my opinion; Filets were too salty. Fries were decent, but the cheese on them was GOOD! Beer was good as well and I liked their selection. 

Prices-Food was average, but their beer was cheap! 60 oz for $6...how could you go wrong!??

Atmosphere-Cozy almost at
home feel for the dining area. I think made the service better. Bar was a different story. Just not my thing to eat in areas with smoke. Just drinking? Sure.

Overall, I would definitely go back to Chicago Brewing Co., but only for their cheap beer.

Great place to watch a game on the tv, drink, and smoke a cigar or two. I liked the deep dish pizza and the appetizers. So great atmosphere, food, and drinks. Just be warned its a cigar bar too. So don't be surprised to see people smoking a stick.

Some of the best beer you will get in Vegas. I love the Old Town Brown and the Weizenheimer. The garlic knots are excellent and they are incredibly cheap at happy hour.  The deep dish pizza is good but I don't think it's great. It pretty much falls completely apart when you try to get a slice. The bartenders are always cool friendly people but be warned, you may be waiting a long time for a beer. The service is always very slow despite the friendly staff.  You could be the only person in the entire bar and still be waiting with an empty glass. That's the only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars. A great pregame spot when you want to hang out downtown.
Okay place to grab a beer and watch the game. The food is average and prices are okay not to pricey but not cheap.

This is a difficult review, because if it were a bar/brewery only, I would EASILY give them 4 stars. I think their beer is pretty solid, and the happy hours prices are excellent. There are a few things that irked me, but we'll get to them. 

I was here with a pretty large party, so I suppose you should take that into account. Service wasn't exceptional, and maybe serving a large party affects that somewhat. The manager of the restaurant was extremely polite and accomodating, and I appreciate that. I don't regret celebrating here at all-- I'm glad I chose this place. I probably could have done just as well picking a big ol' corporate BJ's brewery or a Yardhouse, but as always, I give preference to smaller businesses and experience their unique spin on food. 

I tried their standard pale, which was very smooth but perhaps a bit uninspiring. Perhaps it could have been a bit more floral but it was very easy to drink and that is a plus. Their amber is sweet and comforting. Better than a bottle of Fat Tire no doubt. I also tried their brown ale. Slightly less malty than a New Castle, but again, fairly easy to drink. Trying these beers was fun and I would like to try more of them. The coconut porter looks especially tempting, so I'll have to save that for next time.

My food experience wasn't phenomenal, but it was decent enough I suppose. I ordered the italian beef sandwich, because my understanding is that its' an authentic Chicago food item. The meat was perhaps a tad more well done than I would have liked, and salty, but the Au Jois was adequate. The macaroni salad was pretty standard. The chicago pizza that others ordered looked pretty agreeable, and the Reuben looked delicious-- I think I will choose it next time. 

I think it's a bit silly that happy hour is not allowed in the dining area. Several from my party walked over to the bar and brought back beers at a much better price than the rest of us who had to order at full price. I don't quite see the purpose of this policy, but hey it's not my business. 
For my birthday, a complementary chocolate pizookie was served.  I am partial to chocolate but it was honestly pretty damn good, and I do appreciate gestures such as this. 

So how does this place stack up to a BJ's or Yardhouse? Probably about even. I'd give them a 3.5, rounded up to 4 because of that personal touch, and the novelty of brewing their own beers. I WOULD certainly recommend this place for an event , just manage your expectations I suppose. It was a cool looking, fun environment to celebrate in and I thank them for helping me have a fun night.

This is a must stop whenever I am in Vegas. The pizza is freaking awesome, I love the filet mignon sliders, and the beer is pretty damn good. I stopped in earlier this week and tried their seasonal beer - Belgian Saison. Total thumbs up!

Female bartender with large blonde hair (Shelly?), has been rather rude and giving poor service as of late. Makes it easier to pass it up as well because the beer selection has been slipping. With all the other new brewpubs popping up, I think they mainly rely on their gambling barflies rather than their product.

This was my first and sadly my last time here! A friend of mine who has eaten there on several prior occasions suggested the place. Since she spoke so highly of it, I really wanted to try it.

At first glance, I was very impressed with the decor, but that's about the only thing that impressed me. My dining companion said that she only gets one thing when she dines at Chicago Brewing Company -- the Shrimp Cocktail. When they brought her plate of shrimp out(it was previously served in a cocktail glass), the first thing she said to me was "the shrimp are smaller and the price went up since the last time I ate here."

I wanted to try a Chicago Style Pizza and so I ordered one. The first one came out, I didn't like the sauce they used although the toppings were quite tasty (bacon and chicken) We asked if they would re-make the pizza this time using a white sauce and they obliged. The second one came out but was obviously under cooked. I had one piece of each pizza, a coke and just because I didn't eat much I ordered a root beer float.

My companion and I both left unsatisfied. Within less than an hour, I became physically ill. From reading the reviews here it seems like most of the people like the place but that was not our experience. Unfortunately, I can't agree with everyone else this time. In my opinion the food is mediocre at best and priced a bit on the high side. A complete and total waste of $40 and talk about something that will ruin someones day? Everyone is entitled to their opinion and I have posted an accurate, fair review. Thanks for taking the time to read. Hope your experience (if you decide to go here) is leaps and bounds better than mine was!

If the business owner is willing and should happen to see this review; I would graciously accept a refund but I don't believe you could ever convince me to return.

I have mixed emotions when it comes to giving this place my rating. When I first went there it was perfect and I had nothing negative to say at all. Then the last 2 times I was there the food was cold and their fries were old and stale, and there booze there is, in my opinion, kinda weird tasting.
Not bad but most of this is smoking video porker.  Had the chicken enchilada soup, which paired nicely with the sun down stout, on nitro.

This is a classic homestyle pub where you always feel welcome when you walk in. The food is well-made, reasonably priced and seasoned well. We sat at the bar and it wasn't too loud - it wasn't too smoky and it was friendly. The bartenders were both personable and very attentive.I don't suggest gambling here as the machines were very greedy. 

My understanding is that there is a cigar bar upstairs since I don't smoke cigars I didn't opt to check it out. However, I did notice there was a lot of traffic going up the stairs to that cigar bar, which I shall take as a positive sign.

I suggest this little gem for the nights when you just want to hang with friend, have a beer and relax.

I had this place bookmarked after seeing several delicious looking pictures being posted on yelp. Hubby and I decided to come here for dinner and we left full and satisfied. The beer here is brewed on site and has won several awards at the Great American Beer Festival and The World Beer Cup. Did I try any beer? Nope! Another visit I will though ;)

We sat in a comfy booth in the dining area. Our server was very nice and checked on us often and went over any questions we had. The menu had so many good choices so hubby and I decided to pick out 2 different things to share. We ordered the "Buffalo Chicken Wrap" priced at $10 and the "South Side Cheese Steak" priced at $10 with a $3 up charge for the substitution of onion rings instead on fries.

Buffalo Chicken Wrap - The chicken tenders are handmade and tossed in hot sauce then put into a tortilla with lettuce, tomato and chipotle ranch. I asked them to leave the lettuce out. The chicken was all white and cooked perfectly. The whole wrap would have been good to me if the hot sauce wasn't on it. It wasn't hot at all and tasted like straight up vinegar. The portion was great and the fries that came with it were delicious. I asked for a side of ranch to dip my fries in and the ranch was cold, thick and delicious. Hubby thought the wrap was OK, but this isn't something I personally would order again unless is was minus the funky vinegar flavor. 

South Side Cheese Steak - This has beef with peppers, mushrooms, and onions, with their our own signature beer cheese sauce. This sandwich was just delicious! The steak was tender and flavorful, the peppers and onions cooked just right and the beer cheese sauce makes this sandwich a match made cheese steak heaven! The onion rings were beer battered and yummy! I could easily just eat a plate of the onion rings!

Happy Hour is daily from 4 - 7 pm. HH is only available in the beer garden, loft and lounge according to their menu.

While there we noticed a promotion for "Slot August Nights" where you can stop in and enter to win a 1966 Ford Mustang! You can enter at their other locations Magoos, Loose Caboose, Golden West and of course here at Chicago Brewing Company. Just ask your server for details.
Been to NYC and, the pizza here is better than 90 percent of what Ive had in the big apple. Amazing deep dish pizzas that leave you wanting more....but your belly will bust!

This won't take long.

It seriously was just MEH. Nothing to get excited over. Nothing bad. Nothing great. Just, MEH!

Went there a few weeks ago and fell in love with it. Great home brews, pizza and the flights they have aren't 4 little 2 oz pours, they are 8-12 glasses. awesome. great staff and great price. will def. be back

came here with some buddies after finding out about this place on thrillist. the food was great. we ordered some wings and fried calamari for appetizers. then we each ordered our own deep dish pizzas which were extremely delicious! the waitress, I can't remember her name but she was very pretty and was really great. I noticed that she didn't write a single thing down and got every single aspect of our order correct. I thought that was pretty amazing. we ordered the hef, it wasn't the greatest hef I've had, it was a little flat and light, wish we had time to try more of their beers. will definitely go back next time I'm in Las Vegas.

My nephew took my wife and I there and it brought back some old school memories. The food was very good it also had a cigar lounge and the beer very tasty tasty. My very first stop when I hit Vegas again,

This place is truly a hidden gem in downtown -- it's tucked away in a corner of the Four Queens and it's very easy to miss.

Absolutely amazing pizza.  The 9 inch personal deep dish with all the meats is only $10 and is huge.  It's so good.  Varying soft & crunchy crust, not too oily, and just a slight bit of sweetness to the sauce.

Service was fine even though it was kinda busy because of sports.

I come here all the time and the service is always amazing. Bella has been my server the last couple times and she's absolutely wonderful. She helped me find my favorite beer! The garlic knots are soooooo delicious. 10/10 love this place.
Horrible example of deep dish or any pizza for that matter. Would probably go to Dominos before ever come back here.

It's getting downgraded and fast - 2 stars.

Listen people, we understand that times are tough - their tough on us too. But if you're going to cut back on your happy-hour offerings, don't use the lame excuse that it because there were too many drunks making trouble.

No more $10 yard beer specials and who knows what else was lost in this recent management decision.

If you cant manage your restaurant and its patrons, just close down and make room for someone who can.
Been here three of four times now. excellent beer, nice little place, sit smoke a cigar, get away from the slots for a time. I'd definitely go here again. Oh and Ask for Kimmie.

Come here for the beer only. The food we had was awful. We had the chicken wings as appetizers. They were not cooked well. She had the burger. The fries were the only good thing. I had a sandwich with 3 types of meat. Too salty and on one of the bites I heard a hard crack sound.  It was a bone. Her soda was watered down. Like I said the beer was the only thing good.

First time here. It's separated into a bar and restaurant area. No smoking in the restaurant area.

Not many TVs in either area. Could be the only down side.  

The beers are great and cheap during happy hour. The salads are made to order and good sized.  

Nadine was a great waitress. No conplaints. Will definitely come back.

Continue my night by las Vegas street and I found this cozy brewery sport bar nice service which provide me with some beer tastes so I can have the right choice to drink food was a little dry but good at the end I would come back probably.

What a great place. My father and I came here Friday from San Diego around 2:30 and had a great time. Ordered the chicken fingers as an appetizer and had a thin crust pizza for lunch. Food was great. Service was even better. Our server/bartender Tiffany i believe but receipt says Kimber was off the charts great. She greeted us with an awesome smile and followed through with a great  customer service passion. She should be applauded. About 5'9 Brunette lady. Awesome smile. Really good. 
Thanks
William
San Diego

The food here is actually pretty good. It's some of that food bar food that hits the spot in those clutch moments of hunger and you're not sure what to eat. I have not been disappointed by anything I've ordered, though I have had friends who have (I think they just didn't know what they actually wanted).

Definitely give it a try! May not be everyone's cup of tea, but I enjoyed it.

Awesome place to go with my family we get
Pizza and it is always good. Good costumer service. But it always smells like smoke I thought that was from the bar. Other than that it is a good place to eat at!!!

Difficult place to get to since you either go up the stairs to the third floor or take the Elevator to the third floor and walk through Magnolias restaurant which is a very tight walk through with all the tables and chairs. Once inside the restaurant which is very small you can sit on the 21 and over side or the family section. Food is pretty good and the prices reasonable. I had the Filet Mignon sliders which were good, but my family had the spicy chicken sandwich and meat pizza. My family said the spicy chicken sandwich was very delicious and the Pizza was awesome! I had the 9.00 dollar beer sampler which was more than enough beer! I highly recommend this place. Remember it's in the Four Queens casino.

I went here on Fourth of July around 9 o'clock not expecting it to be busy and it was not, I figured everyone was doing their own thing. I was craving some great cracker thin, crispy style pizza. We ordered the artichoke dip to start. It had a nice cheesy layer on the top, which was piping hot, but the inside of the dip was not that hot, which leads me to believe this thing came straight from the freezer. Aside from it being unbelievably salty, the flavor was just bland. We also ordered the veggie thin crust pizza, that looked super nice but the only parts of the crust that were crispy were the edges, they didn't cook it long enough for the whole pizza crust to crisp throughout. The veggies seemed fresh enough, but there was barely any cheese and I felt like the sauce they used came straight from a can. The food was just meh, but the server was nice and they had a decent beer selection. My friend also left his phone there and they were honest and kept it at the bar for us. I would maybe consider going back to drink at the bar, but probably never eat here again.

Just ok, not much to write home about. Dark in here and only 2 tv's weird for a s bar that says its a sports bar. 
Had a club sandwich we split average price. Played video poker, asked if our drinks were comped cause we are playing, they adjusted the bill.
Maybe more a local place as the one server looked so unhappy to see us.

First, the food here was excellent. I really enjoyed my club sandwich, and being a club sandwich aficionado, that means it must be good.

The beer could have been better. They claim a lot of awards, but they don't seem to be very recent. Small menu and nothing was really "wow."

This place has thee best deep dish pizza I've ever had! All of the ingredients were super fresh & we always have the friendliest servers. We went close to closing time & they still let us sit & eat & made us feel welcomed!

My friends and I decided to grab a beer late at night and walked into this place around 10:30. I loved their beer (hence the 1 star instead of 0), but the customer service was simply horrible. Our host didn't give us the drink menu at first and we made eye contacts with him to ask for one, but he looked at us and did not come back until quite a few minutes later - although there was only one other table in the hall. When we tried asking him a question about the menu he cut me off mid-sentence with "i'm not your server." The manner in which he talked to us was clearly very rude and unprofessional as a host. Our server also had so much attitude and sarcasm in her tone. She spilled some of our beer on the floor and table as she brought them over, and when we asked her to repeat which one was which she said something along the line of "ask me later unless you want to keep the wet table" as she went to grab something to wipe the table with.
We felt bad for walking in close to closing time and tried to figure out why everyone was so displeased, and tried to stay nice and polite as much as possible to make up for whatever that was, but were unable to identify/solve it. I may return to this place in the future, but will surely be afraid that something like this may happen again.

Here in town visiting a relative in the hospital. First impression of this place gave it a, comfy, old times feel.

Our hostess and server were both very friendly, the menu had a great selection, I had the Meatball Sliders. It was delicious! It didn't take very long for our food to come out and the waitress was very attentive. I would defiantly come back here!

Deep.Dish.Pizza. 

Need I say more?! Give it a try! Soooo yum. I was literally swimming in cheese. They're super generous lol. 
Beers were okay. They seem to have the same beers on tap, nothing crazy special. The flight is a good deal if you're looking to just quench your thirst.
You can't beat this for the money. Great chicken fingers and pizza.

We've been coming to this place on every Vegas visit for years, this week we came nearly every day. I love the deep dish pizza. My husband loves that one side allows cigars, so he can watch sports and have a cigar. Great service from Mike and Bob. Great prices on beer and 1/2-price apps weekdays from 3 to 6.

I had been coming here since this place opened its doors....but do not come here anymore.

The quality of the beer has become a damn joke and management has completely lost it.

It is really sad to see one of the breweries we had here in Vegas that used to be so great....fall to be so low. And please understand...used to be great..REALLY GREAT and I used to be here 3-4 times a week.

I had waited to do this review.....but it seems to just get worse. It's really sad

I've been driving by this place now and then for years, always meaning to stop in and check it out.Well, the wait is over, today I finally parked and went in, ready for what awaited us...
Interesting layout. You walk in, straight ahead is what I'd call the well lit main dining area, the the left behind the doors is the darker bar area, can get food in there too, then upstairs from that is the cigar room. We choose the bar area, sat at a table and was immediately served by a friendly woman. Not bad so far. Menu is the pretty standard bar food, peppered with 'Chicago' styled food, pizza, sandwiches, etc. I tried a Ramblin Reck amber ale, a very tasty house draft, highly recommended. Also ordered the Chicago Italian Beef and the wife got a cheese pizza.
The issue here was the food service. A lot of what we ordered came out wrong, I would not recommend the coleslaw (too dry, like cabbage and nothing else) nor the fries (limp). The pizza was good as was the Italian beef. 
I may give it another shot one day, at the very least, to enjoy a few of those Ramblin Recks.

I like this place. Happy Hour is from 4p to 7p all week; 11p to 1a on Sunday-Thursday.

Noise is tolerable, and there are a few tables with outlets nearby if you're looking for a place to work.

Nice building, nice folks, beer decent.  Happy Hour is the best value.  Can't say I've ever had the food here.

Great place to recharge! The staff is super friendly in a not fake way and the bar food is actually really great! I have been to Vegas tons of times but never to old town and I'll be back now. It's a great place to grab a drink and good food and actually be able to sit. The filet mignon sliders, wings, and mozzarella sticks are yum! Plus check out the happy hour!!

This place was just okay. Service for happy hour was pretty nonexistent. Yes, I know I am ordering one beer and one appetizer but that's why it's happy hour--some people choose to get happier than others, and you still have to wait on me. $5.40 is ultra-cheap for a beer and an appie, but we were there for a couple hours and my friend (who was of the getting-happier variety) had to wave down the bartender who would pass us on his way to and from the other happier tables. Also, the loft is a cigar bar, which I didn't know going into it. I'm not that bothered by that type of smoke but some people might be.

I did have a blueberry beer which I did like a lot, but it would have led to a severe case of gutrot were I to have had more than one. My friend kept downing their IPA and believe me, her happy hour mission was accomplished.

Had some time to kill, so I stopped in here to grab a bite to eat and watch the Cowboys vs Eagles Sunday night football game.  It has been over 5 yrs since I last visited this place and have heard a lot of good things about it, so I figured it was time.  I'm glad I did!

The waiter brought over the menu and as I turned through each page I got more and more excited......2 pages dedicated to Sliders, what?!!  I love Sliders!  Yes, it's true....two whole pages (see pics).  One page has exotic style sliders....ie Alligator, etc.  The other page has some unique ones.....I decided on getting a 6-pack ($15) which allows you to select 2 styles of Sliders.  I chose the Black and Blue (Black Angus w/Cajun Spices, Blue Cheese Crumbles, Caramelized Onions, & Chipotle Mayo)  and the Chicken Cordon Bleu (Grilled Chicken, Honey Baked Ham, Swiss Cheese & Honey Mustard Sauce).  However, I was extremely curious about the Ghost Sliders, which has Ghost Sauce, made from the world's hottest pepper....the Ghost Pepper.  Plus there's an entire 1/2 page on the menu dedicated to items prepared with Ghost Pepper!

As most of my friends know, I love spicy food.....but have never tried anything with Ghost Pepper before.  As a reference point, Habanero Peppers are 350,000 on the Scoville Scale, which measures spiceness.  Ghost Pepper registers 1,000,000+ on the Scoville Scale!

I asked the waiter if I could have a side of the Ghost Sauce so I could try it out.  He said sure.....however, he didn't tell me I'd get charged an extra $1 for that....which kind of irks me.  Keep that in mind if you decide to order a side of it.

To wash it down, I had a Hardway IPA ($3)....that's right $3 for a 20 oz glass!

After a few minutes the 6-pack of Sliders came out as well as the Ghost Sauce.  I wanted to try the Ghost Sauce before the food, so I took a toothpick and dipped the tip into the Sauce.....it burned the hell out of my tongue!  That is seriously H-O-T!  It's no joke!  But that's what I enjoy!

So....I took a Chicken Cordon Bleu Slider and dipped a little Ghost Sauce on it and took a bite.....yum!  It was great!  Perfect proportion of Ham & Chicken.....they complimented each other well.  The Bun was soft and fresh.....again, perfect.  Next I tried the Black and Bleu Slider.....it was just as good.  Although I could have had it without the Red Onion....I'm not a fan of grilled Red Onions...oh well, next time I get them without it.

I'm glad I ordered the IPA because I needed it to put the 5 alarm fire out in my mouth.  I also ordered a glass of Blueberry Vanilla Wheat ($2) after I was done with the IPA....it was also very good and cheap!  Can't get over how cheap the Beer was!

Overall, it was an awesome experience.  Good food, good Beer, and I lost my Ghost Pepper virginity!

Other things worth mentioning.....there's a 7 lb Burger challenge, yes 7 LBS!  If you can eat it in less than 12 min and change, then you get it named after you.  Believe it or not, it's been done before.  No way I could do that!

Will I return?  As the Macho Man Randy Savage would say......Oh Hell Ya!
Horrible food, Buffalo sliders tasted like puuure salt sweet potatoe fries tastes burnt and hard as a rock, servers were rude and non helpful.

I've been to the brewery a few times and enjoyed it the fruit flavored blueberry beer is really good so ordered the beer the bare tender told me we are all out of any fruity beers. I seriously doubted it. Cus the guy next to him said under his breath keep that fruity shit downstairs. How are you of of beer at a brewery what a joke. 

Being that it has a Chicago name most would assume it's a Chicago sports friendly bar. Well the other night during the Chicago Hockey game there were plenty of Chicago fans I jokingly said to the bartender hey were in a Chicago bar why aren't you a Chicago fan?! 

Wow the attitude I got from the bartender and the customer at the bar was amazing. He responded this isn't a Chicago bar!!  I will never return there again used to be my go to spot to watch football games. 

Just a price of advice have Chicago friendly bartenders at least support the name. Jeez. I felt like I was in LA with the way they acted.

Best Sunday football spot that we have found over 15+ years 

Lots of fun 
Great beer 
Great bar 
Great bartenders 

Can't go wrong spot

This was our first experience here and it's walking distance so we decided to try it out. 

What an awesome experience !! The bartender who helped us, she was too cool! Friendly, personable and you could easily tell by how she interacted with everyone, she's been there a while and many there in the bar are local. 

We had a great meal; and thought we were taking home food but nope! Too good and we continued to nibble until it was gone.. the steak was excellent! The green beans with red bell  pepper so tasty and the margarita pizza  yummy!! 

Overall a great experience and we will for sure be back!
Cant beat 24hours.  I had sliders with caramelized onions and blue cheese... delicious. Their IPA isnt half bad either.

Yay! I am so very happy that we loved this place. 

There's a very relaxed environment, I love that you can look right into the kitchen all the while following your team on the flat screens. We ate in the main dining room, downstairs and didn't venture around - but it was a great experience. 

I had the Strawberry Harvest Wheat brew and it was delightful, not overpowering and quite refreshing. I was interested in the steak sandwich; however, the waiter talked me into the club sandwich. The portion was huge - which is good for taking home, but the club itself was so large that I couldn't actually take a bite. It was cut into quarters, and speared with a long toothpick - but there wasn't a good way to take a bite of it. I ended up with a handful of food that I just had to kind of gently shove into my mouth. I was NOT happy with it. My husbands hot pastrami sandwich was phenomenal! 

We will absolutely be back to try this out again; although I will definitely not be getting the club sandwich. :)
These guys are the shit! They serve amazing food and drinks, they're extremely friendly, quick and efficient. This place is a must.
This tucked away place is a favorite of mine because of how chill the bartenders are and my favorite coconut shrimp

I've had a restaurant.com GC for Chicago Brewery for about 6 months as I knew Id eventually find myself hungry in the middle of the night. Last night was that night.

They had only their late night menu available, but there were plenty of options available.  My girlfriend and I ordered the filet mignon sliders, garlic knots, and chicken fingers. All were well above average, but not amazing enough to come back exclusively for.  We didn't get to try the pizza because of the late night menu, but I remember it being pretty darn good.

We also had the beer sampler... I'm not much of a beer drinker but all their beers were pretty good. The sampler was more than enough beer for the both of us.

if you are looking for a place to have a drink, eat some good bar food, maybe watch a game and smoke a cigar this is the place for you.  Great place to grab some drinks with some friends and munch on some good food.  I have been here plenty of times and have always had a pleasant time.
Fantastic pizza and chicken wings.  Service can be spotty and the bar area can get really smokey with drunk tourists smoking cigars.  Still, it's darn good.
ANOTHER great speed lunch in our lunch break!   Thank you guys AGAIN!  In and out in 40 mins with time to chill!  Fresh, Hot and killer lunch special!

This is an awesome place to come and relax and have a couple of house microbrews. Had never eaten here before until last Thursday. The service was pretty good, attentive and fast. The food was pretty good as well. Had the veggie pizza and it was to die for. Typically don't take leftovers home, but did this time because the pizza was so good. 

Now I wont just look at this place as a great place to have a good beer on the weekend or after work. I will consider it for a good lunch or dinner spot as well. Kudos!

Thanks to Ken M. who organized an UYE here tonight, I got to try their new wild game sliders.  They were added to the menu last fall.  The six sliders are made from the following game animals:  alligator, antelope, buffalo, jackalope (rabbit and antelope meat mixed together), rabbit and wild boar.  They come 3 for $16 (must be all one kind of meat) or a sampler platter of all 6 for $30.

Three of us shared the sampler and we each had a taste of all 6 meats.  My rating would be from best to least: Rabbit, wild boar, alligator, antelope, jackalope, and bison.
