I will say however that once in a while I got a faint smell of cigarette smoke; I'm guessing the servers exiting and entering the bar to serve food.  Anywhere you sit in the dining room you have full view of televisions (sports channels, bleh) and the kitchen.   We ordered garlic knots and pretzel bite appetizers.  The garlic knots are huge and delicious!  Friends ordered pizza and a Vienna beef sandwich.  I ordered the flat iron steak dinner.  Everything was delicious!  I cut a garlic knot in half and created a flat iron steak slider.  The handcrafted root beer is now my number one favorite root beer.  I didn't think my childhood RB favorite could ever be knocked down to second best, but their root beer succeeded.  The service was friendly and attentive.  The only thing I could see improving this restaurant is make it all no smoking so I can check out the bar area (but that's for my personal benefit).  Overall I would say this restaurant offers my favorite garlic knots and root beer hands down in Las Vegas.  I love the brick and stained glass decor.  Five stars as I'm going to overlook the few and far between faint smells of cigarette smoke in the dining room as the food was delicious!

My little brother LOVES this place and I really like all of the options they give you but the food quality is okay. The environment is nice and cozy with their huge booths and can fit 6 people comfortably.
Just had the Mac & cheese with pulled pork and all I can say is that it does not compared to the filet mignon mac & cheese they use to have and now I'm sad. 3 stars just for the excellent service.

This was my first time here. I arrived a little before my friend who is a regular here and I found a spot at the bar. I am the type who just wants a beer that the bartender recommends. Thankfully I lucked out and was greeted with a smile by Alan!! He was super friendly without even realizing I was meeting up with one of his regulars . That leads me to believe this is a place to come enjoy a beer with good company!! I decided to try their seasonal blueberry vanilla beer (yes! I know that sounds gross) it honestly was delicious and I enjoyed not just one but two of them! They have a variety of different options and the glasses come chilled!!!!!! Check it out if you're in the area and looking for a yummy beer with fun bartenders and interesting regulars .. I can't speak on the food or any of that just beer and crowd

This is a cool little brewery & restaurant.  I had a thin crust pizza and it was good.  The IPA I had was just average. The root beer they have on tap was very good. Decent customer service from a nice gentleman who was one of the only few servers working during a busy afternoon.

So happy we listened to our fellow Yelpers! Had the garlic knots and shared the Chicago deep dish between the 2 of us. The food was fantastic! 
They'll provide samples of their brews - I enjoyed the old town brown the most.

5/4/16 Service was decent, lots of choices of beers but I was set on trying the house drafts.  I ended up ordering the flight sampler of their 9 beers.  Nothing stood out as well as the Old Town Brown and the Hardway IPA which I'd rate both at a 4/5.

 Ordered garlic knots 3.5/5 the bread was fantastic the sauce 1/5 not so much.  Also had the chicken tenders the crispness of the breading was great. I think next time I would do the sauce on the side. Had the Hotiyaki, wasn't quite hot enough for my taste perhaps next I'll go hotter. 

 Overall an average experience.  I read great things of their pizza so next time I'll pass on the knots and have pizza and tenders. I'll give then a chance for redemption.


Came back 11/10/16: service was much better this time thanks to (Ronika) we ended up eating in the dining hall this time around since I had my son with. 

Ordered the Italian Beef with onion rings. I really liked that it is served dry and you can add the peppers and au jour as needed.  Great bread that held up and tasted great.  The onion rings were just OK. 4.25/5

My son had the Build your own burger-  so he opted for bacon and cheddar medium well..with fries.   He loved it.. I did try the fries they as well just OK. 4/5

Moving my initial review of 3 stars to 4 stars.

The staff at this location is in one word simply AMAZING.  

On 11/23/16 My family and I happened upon this location by accident as we were catching the Elvis show here and decided to give it a shot.

Right away the energy was great as the servers Michael and Tiffany were constantly in motion and handling the patrons within moments I had my Brown Ale in hand. 

I noticed the 9" Chicago deep dish pizza for $9.99 and thought I'd give it a go.  The Pizza takes roughly 25 minutes to make and upon arriving I knew I had made a great choice.

The Pizza was hearty and cooked perfectly The cheese was holding the piece from coming out of the pie after cutting it.  The pepperoni, sausage and cheese made up the 1" thickness of the pie. I was only able to finish 1/2 of it.  Lucky for me my family was there to help finish the remaining pieces along with the house Root Beer (the menu states voted Best of Las Vegas and after tasting I see why) definitely a must try.

The next night we came back 11/23/16 and brought even more guests as we went from a party of 4 to a party of 11.  Again the service was spot on but this time we tried several appetizers.  Everything from the garlic knots with marinara sauce, mozzarella sticks and table favorite chicken tenders satisfied our need to feed.

The chicken tenders were another high quality item the breading was seasoned perfectly and 5 large juicy pieces are sure to please.

So if you happen to be around Fremont Street and have a large appetite inside the 4 Queens casino you will find this great place. 

Enjoy

Jesse in the bar started an argument with my elderly Veteran father and then kicked him and my entire family out of the restaurant for life. We have been eating dinner here every Friday for the last 7 years. Jesse is a hot head that should not be in customer service!!

Billy and Johnny have been very kind over the last 7 years so we will miss them but as long as Jesse is around we will express our dissatisfaction with Chicago Brewery! What a joke!

They changed the menu and went once after that and we were disappointed since it wasn't the same and thought "another restaurant goes corporate...." after a time, some months and in the middle of the week we decided to return and see if it improved, it has! The burgers are once more great, good steak sandwich, best root beer and onion rings, they now have dessert which before they didn't have anything at all to speak of, and of course their beer is excellent. They did take some items off the menu, hope they still serve the Alfredo Pizza which we highly recommend.... We live close by so we were happy that we have this local's place available again.

I live very close to here and I know it's always a great place to go for some awesome bar food. Their chicken finger appetizer is amazing! The chicken finger are very meaty & the flavor is out of this world. My fiance had the Chili Burger, and it was hands down the best burger he has ever had, although he had to eat it with a fork. Haha he didn't mind once he took a bite. I had the all American Sliders & they were very very good. The flavor was better then my father's! & that's saying something. The service was incredible & very fast. But to put icing on the cake, the Bay Breeze I got was the best in town. Perfect ratio. I have to say, I'm in love with this place & you can't beat the prices!

Don't go here now if you were a fan of their old food. We went after not going for like 2 months. They completely changed the menu and now it tastes like bar food. They took off everything we used to eat and now their food is absolutely terrible. We were also treated terribly by the staff. We only saw our waitress once even though she had no problem spending time with the booth next to us for our whole visit. I will never ever go back here again because they obviously aren't catering to the dine in side as well anymore. I wouldn't be surprised if they turned into just a bar. 

P.s. don't order their meatball sub unless you want the taste of fake cheese and a disgusting after taste to linger in your mouth.

CBC is pretty solid as brewery/restaurants go, but nothing special. Though, as far as micro breweries in Las Vegas, it's the best I've tried. The beer selection is decent but nothing I tried struck me as special. And isn't that the point of brewing your own beer? To be different than all the other guys? The food is typical brewery fare, comfort food, pizza, and a lot of fried stuff. 

The service is quick and friendly, and the prices are reasonable.

Been here a time or two before, and it's always nice. But this time we walked in sat down in the restaurant down stairs and immediately were approached by promoters and they gave out free items and free shots. Perfect because we were celebrating a birthday. It was happy hour from 4-7 and our server even extended the happy hour prices past happy our. Beyond nice. Food was delicious and perfect temperature. I'd be more than happy to visit this establishment again.

Worse service , after a long time client because someone disrespected me because I'm gay.., she she a Prost Nig ! 
She on them , whatever are many places to spend my money , they can keep their girls asking for money there so trashy!

Chicago Brewing Co. -

- An UPDATE 

THREE THINGS..I NOTICED IN LAST SUNDAY's Happy Hour:
1. Its Happy Hour STARTS at 4pm, NOT at 5pm as I had mistakenly thought before.

2. Beware:  There is "NO Happy Hour SEATING at the Bar Counter downstairs"!

3. Its HH is POPPING during game time with excited screaming fans (me included)!

YES, its attractive offers are still ALL there, i.e.:
- 22oz draft for $2.50; wine, 3; well drinks, 4; delicious HH bar dishes ($3-6) ); 
- Its reverse HH still goes between 10-midnight (I've got to give it a try after movies sometime)!

YELPY DETAILS YOU CAN IGNORE:
- After a long walk in Pueblo Park yesterday (Sunday) afternoon, I wisely decided to hydrate myself properly, well, deliciously! So, I went to CBC for the 22oz draft and thin crust pepperoni pizza($6 plus $1 extra for pepperoni)...over exciting NFL games! 
 - And...What a healthy HYDRATING experience it was, indeed! 

Now, here's something STRANGE about "Seating at the BAR COUNTER", though: 

- When I got in CBC around 4:30, I first went upstairs to take a look at their small loft bar. The bar counter itself was completely full; the lounge area still had a few bar tables. However, other than the lone barkeep, I did not see any server upstairs (perhaps, not until after 5pm). 

- As I was alone this time, I wanted to sit at the bar counter, so I went back to the downstairs lounge.   Here I was surprised to find out that the Happy Hour seating is "restricted" to the lounge area! In other words, one cannot have HH at the downstairs bar counter itself! 
- I think the reason for CBC's doing this is that they want the gaming machines available to playing customers. Perhaps, CBC knows that most their HH customers are NOT INTERESTED in playing video poker machines?
- There's no such restriction in the loft bar lounge, however. 

- Well, luckily, I got a comfy bar table along the wall, with a great viewing angle for several tv's! The food and drinks were great! My server was pleasant and attentive. And the atmosphere was just right for the occasion! The lounge area was almost completely full by 6pm, full of screaming fans for the 49ers and later for the "home team" Bears [who lost, if you care to know, to the Texans!]

BTW: - Oh yes, there's an elevator, too, hidden around the corner of the bar. So, CBC is handicapped friendly.

Peterskis, Nov 2012
--
Cool spot. Good service. Alan was a very good bartender. I highly recommend this bar after about 10:30. Nice crowd to boot
Had the nitro stout and it was exceptional. But now I feel sick from the gd smoke, even though we sat in the no smoking dining area. If you can't stand cig smoke, cross this place off your list.

The BF and I sat on the patio to enjoy some beer. It was during their happy hour so we ordered off of the specials of select appetizers. Beers are $2 off, $1 off wells, half off the house wine. 

Their patio is pretty nice and in the afternoon part of it sits in the shadow of the building so it isn't too bad. There are TVs out there if you want to catch a game.

Order of teriyaki chicken tenders - these were crispy but the teriyaki was too salty for me since it was tossed with it. Probably would order them plain and just put a little. 

Mini cheese pizza - this was pretty alright flatbread type. I wouldn't really order those again. 

We also got some waffle sweet potato fries which were crispy and really good. 

Washed it down with their Black Star Stout which was really nice, nitro nice dark malt and dark chocolate notes.

Service was decent, but standard. 

I definitely love their beer and some of their food, but this visit was just A-OK.

The food and beer are fine, but the service, specifically in the bar, is awful. I have been on two separate occasions and sat in the bar, and each time had to wait upwards of 10 minutes to be greeted, let alone be given menus and have an order taken. On my last visit, the server took our menus away after we ordered appetizers and when we asked for them back so we could order dinner, she told us that she was off at 6. This all happened at 5:15, as if we were inconveniencing her to order food and spend money in the establishment. Needless to say we paid for our appetizers and went over PT's to eat.
Nice place, great food and Pizza. I will be going back. A great place to eat while at Fremont Street
Well this place doesn't suck!  Yum-oh! Chicago style deep dish!!! Most excellent - and the bartenders....great service!!!

DISCLAIMER: BEER AND SERVICE REVIEW ONLY!

I dropped by here and caught a bit of Monday Night Football in the upstairs sports bar area.

The bartender hooked me up with some samples and I ended up enjoying a hefeweizen (although they call it something else) and a stout.

I preferred the hefeweizen to the stout. It had a nice finish.

Service was fine, nothing special.  

That is all.

I visited this place quite a while ago, but I can still distinctly remember the reasons why I haven't been back.

First, the wait...we waited a looooong time to be seated, a longer time to be waited upon, and the very longest time to receive our pizza.  I was not impressed with the service at all - if you're gonna make me wait, at least smile when you get to my table.

The pizza arrived almost 45 minutes after we placed our order and it was lukewarm, which suggested to me that it had been sitting for a while.  My fianc and I were only one of two tables at the time, so it's kind of incredible that our waitress forgot about us.  When I asked for Parmesan, I got a sticky, goopy, flat-out nasty shaker...aren't you supposed to clean those from time to time??  The pizza itself was okay...the sauce was pretty unusual.  It was a meat sauce, almost like they had run out of regular pizza sauce and subbed a pasta sauce instead.  It was bizarre-tasting and had an equally bizarre texture.

I hate feeling like I've wasted my money.  This was one meal I'd definitely take back if I could.

Fun place with good drinks and food.  Perfect for a group of friends to hit on the weekend and try some unique items.  We ordered the wild game sliders which included Alligator, Antelope, Bison, Jackelope, Rabbit & Wild Boar!  Now of course some were better than others but just to say you had them is a conversation starter.  Also they have a ghost pepper sauce that is not on the menu but if you like it spicy ask for a side of it.  They also have deep fried desserts if you're brave enough.

They have a friendly staff. Food is always great. I'm from Chicago...& this is pretty darn good. Love their pizza. One of the closest to the real deal. Their hot dog is my favorite. 

Can't forget their homemade brewed root beer. You can get a jug really cheap. I get the root beer to go..and buy vanilla bean ice cream..so good. Gotta try it. And if you bring back the jug you can get a refill for cheaper. Also you can buy their home brewed beers in jugs too. Refills also cheaper.
Tasty food, been coming here on and off for years. Machines aren't bad, won some and loss some. Cocktails and beers for all

The service that we received today was absolutely extraordinary! Our waitress, Ronika, was fantastic! This was our first time here and we definitely will be returning here because of her excellent customer service! Thank you for making our first experience incredible.

Our favorite place to go in Vegas. Excellent service and wings. Not to mention superb draft beer. You get a REAL drink here unlike the strip. Bob and Kimmy really make this place great!! The pipe smoker and royal flush winner!!!

YAYY! I found a brewery in Las Vegas!! Great brews and even better the space! So much room and things going on at this spot. Almost a little brewery/sports bar. Then again this is Vegas...lol 

Thanks Nadine for great brews! We'll see you all again EDC WEEKEND!

I am sad to say they absolutely do not deliver on a good pizza!  Nothing at all worthy of the name on their building!  They do however have a good IPA "Hardway" but wonder if they even make it here!  Resident here and in the past have enjoyed coming but just can't find my way to coming back!  Sorry!  There has to be better pizza in Las Vegas!  Gonna find it!
Stopped in for lunch and thoroughly enjoyed the Deep Dish and Chicago Dogs. The beers were good too - I had the Irish stout!

Las Vegas Brewery Stop #3

They have a restaurant and a bar area with the brewery in the middle, which you can see through glass windows. Open 24 hrs. We tried there:

All Nighter Light Ale
Ramblin' Reck Amber Ale
Old Town Brown
Hardway IPA
Weizenheimer
Black Widow Stout
Seasonal: Raspberry Wheat
Seasonal: Belgian Double
Seasonal: Honey Ale?

All the beers were light...flavorful, but not too exciting. The most exciting thing was that they have a variety of sliders with different meats....alligator, antelope, bison, jackelope, rabbit, wild boar. You can order a sampler for $30. I wish we could have tried them, but we were short on time.  Next time.
If you like hot wings try the spicy with a couple drops of ghost pepper sauce.  Gives it a good kick!

Wow great staff... You guys rock.
Whiskey and coke...check
Stout... phenominal, 
Hefeweizen.. oh my beloved tastebuds.. Lucky Vegas goers??? (That is not a real word right hahaha?) Root beer is like old fashioned Hires made with the dry ice. I honestly would give these guys 10 stars. Thanks for a great experience.... When in Vegas this is the place.

Sitting here now and had to write a review the food was such a let down. The filet mignon sliders were such a disappointment I managed to get one bite down. The aju sauce was basically brown water, no seasonings, mushrooms tasted rotten, and it came with a side of plain lettuce?? I can't say about the beers but with food like this I could imagine drink till it tastes good

Deep dish was perfect. Cheese was the ideal texture--stringy, creamy and chewy. Perfect.! We also got a order of chicken strips with hot sauce and they hit the spot!  I enjoyed my large beer. Good meal for a late dinner.
Very good selection of beer at very reasonable prices. The food is also very good, my only complaint was the service was horrible. I will try it again hoping for much improved service.
I got really bad food poisoning from here on Sunday March 4, 2012. I think it was from a salad. Avoid at all costs! Mediocre pizza too.

Went there tonight to celebrate daughter's graduation from UNLV.  They were having their Holiday party and we were told it was Open Bar from 6-9. Could not believe it.  Was also informed a free prime rib buffet.  Had a great time.  We'll definitely be back even if we have to pay. Lol

We came on the recommendation of Desert Companion's best-of eating issue, so I was expecting the good stuff.  What I got was a pizza and a tall Stout, which both turned out to be mediocre.  

What I should have gotten, apparently, was their burger fare.  Between the game sliders (with sweet potato fries, yum!) and the HUGE barbeque burger, I felt like I'd made a mistake with my tiny, thin-crust mini-pizza.  The stout seemed weak-tasting, but I'm the kind of person who likes a dark beer that can hold a spoon in it.  The hef my friend ordered seemed like a far better, tastier option for Vegas' summer. 

The loft area would be great if there were a couple tables instead of being purely for two people to eat / groups to drink in.

Great service and a cozy bar environment. They have a back section where you can get away from people and chat with your friends. They have deep dish pizza, but just like Windy City, it's not REALLY deep dish. It's not deep enough! I don't understand why they can't make the crust thicker by using a deeper pan. The crust was REALLY good though and the pizza, in general, was delicious, so I'm not going to complain too much. They brew their own beer, too; I had their light ale and it was very drinkable. :) If I'm in the area again, I'll stop in fo' sho'!

From the outside the place looks great. Inside decor is not so much - nothing special. Saturday night place was kind of dead, yet the service was really slow. Our server asked if we wanted to reuse our beer glasses and we were drinking different kinds of beers.  Food came out, our server did not ask if we wanted refills on our drinks - glasses were empty. Food was pretty good and seemed fresh.

I've been here many times but this time stands out.....

Rocco and Steve run a great establishment and the craft beers are second to none (try the "All Nighter"), the new menu items are killer (Filet Skewers) and I'd come back just to try them again.

Ask for MJ, Jake, Brady, Erin, Alan, Brian or Jesse behind the bar, there's no better spot for "industry" when we all get off of work.

Cheers!

Chicago Brewing Company (CBC) is alright in my book. They're open 24/7 and have consistently decent food. The variety isn't much and there's nothing healthy options on the menu. 

I will highlight that the soups and house-made root beer are too legit to quit. The bar section is separated from the actual restaurant. Happy Hours during the game are extended into the main dining room.

Good service, decent prices, and portions are large. I always need a to-go box when dining here.

This place would totally be 5 out of 5 hands-down, but I'm pretty bummed with it recently. We have been regulars since we moved to Vegas last year but in the last few months they have gotten new managers that have not only changed the menu but gotten rid of the happy hour in the dining area. Which is a bummer if you ask me because if you have littles or you simply hate being hot-boxed in cigarette smoke you obviously can't nor do you want to sit in the bar. They've also gotten rid of the sweet potato fries which is an absolute sin in my opinion. Haha I know that sounds a little dramatic but they were amazing!! I'm hoping this review secretly brings them back:)
Other than that this place is pretty awesome! Service is great! Food is delish- not your typical bar food. I highly recommend the black and blue sliders. They're out of this world. And of course, the house brewed beers are awesome!! And super cheap. 
Bring back my sweet potato fries and happy hour and we'll move back in:)

Back in town selling houses and stopped in to one of my favorite brewing houses.  Bobby Dickman (yes, that is his real name- I understand he is still in counseling, lol) was tending bar, serving food, checking on patrons, and basically doing everything.
Bobby is a one man band.  The most amazing thing about Bobby is that he never forgets a face, or a name, or an order.  An affable fella.  The 4 Queens are lucky to have him.
The Philly cheesesteak was average today.  Loads of quantity. Not so much on quality.  However, the atmosphere is relaxing, the beer is cold, and Bobby's easy going nature and good humor makes this site an enjoyable experience.

Excellent beer menu and beer flights. Still allows cigars in the bar. I had the muffaletta they have the meats right but the bu and olive spread are not really well suited for a muffaletta sandwich. They would be better off calling it an Italian sandwich. The fries were awesome and the service was excellent.

Great place to visit and have drinks and finger food with friends. The beer is pretty good and the food is tasty (try their wings--they are very good). I would have given it 4 stars but the service was not the best...table was a little sticky, first pizza was unusually sweet (they apparently put brown sugar on their caramelized onions) and the waitress forgot about us a couple of times. Overall, not a bad place to visit.

Yes yes yes... and YES! 

Stopped in for a quick bite before a concert downtown and wow am I impressed and so relieved. I truly gave up on finding decent Chicago-Style pizza. Not only did I find that, but as well they have great tasting crafts on draft and iced cold! 

Started off with the sampler of crafts. Literally a carousel of 9 samples for only $9 bucks! The drinks were great and threw in a side of calamari to start. 

Now normally I have low expectations on calamari as I generally know where to go to have a great appetizer portion of calamari. (An authentic Italian restaurant!) However, this place - best Calamari since my review in Tucson. 

Ordered the Deep Dish pizza (no meat #vegetarian) and again - decent size and definitely enough for 2-3 people (with appetizers and drinks of course). The red sauce was bold but balanced. Amazing stringy cheese when you pull out a slice and not too much dough - which really set it off. 

All in all very impressed and happy to have found a go-to Chicago Style eatery in downtown Las Vegas. It's located in the Four Queens. 

The only caution I would give is if you are sensitive to cigar smoke, this may not be the place for you. Yea - that's right! It duals as a cigar bar and this guy is not offended one bit. As matter of fact the sweet smells of cigar tobacco while eating the rich buttery Deep Dish and refreshing sampler was enough to have me sit back and my chair and feel a great amount of contentment. 

An absolutely must for pizza downtown!

Brad is I great bartender had me feeling like I wanted and the Hefe beer here is awesome. They also sell cigars. I also like there pizza it was delicious.  They have a great happy hour from 4 -6pm. I'm not a big beer drinker but they even have a good alcohol happy hour special. . If you are looking for some good beer come to Chicago Brewery and have a drink but make sure you come while Brad is bartending AF Get A Hefe with a shot of blueberry Vodka.
I love this place. Good beers, good apps and good prices! It's literally a 10 min walk from my house. Every time I come here, I order the All Nighter - never fails me!

The signature deep dish pizza is absolutely delicious! Oooy goooey cheese, crisp crust, and fresh pizza sauce make for a perfect late night dinner. We shared the chicken strips too and they were lightly crispy and the meat was super moist, not greasy at all. Friendly service!

The happy hour is great for beers, but food choices are limited. For $2.00, you will get the 16oz glass and for an extra .50 you can upgrade to the 22oz. The two beers I was struggling between were the Seasonal Daisy Triple and the Fruit Seasonal Mango Hef. Jeff, our server, was helpful in helping me choose between the two. I was looking for a lighter beer and he steered me toward the first option and offered me a sample to make sure I enjoyed it before I committed. The beer was a nice balance to the snack that we ended up getting.

With four choices of food on the happy hour menu, we decided to get something to tide us over and wait until later to get real food. We decided on the chicken tenders ($6) tossed in the Brew-BQ sauce with a side of ghost sauce. I had experience the insane heat of ghost sauce before and was willing to press my luck again. My lips were on fire and I was in sweet agony. I am truly a sadist when it comes to hot and sour foods. If pain is not something you strive for while eating, don't get this sauce. Jeff was kind enough to keep watch on our waters. I drink a lot while eating and it was only intensified ten folds. The tenders came in an order of five large, juicy strips, dosed in the BBQ sauce.

Located inside the Four Queens, the restaurant is easy to spot when entering. It is all self seating and a free for all in trying to find an empty table. 

This past Friday was slammed and I am not sure if Pride had anything to do with it. It could be that this restaurant is always jam packed. Anyways, our party of three found a spot near the bar and situated down. Normally the waitresses will bring the menu, but they were busy, so I snagged a couple. 

When our waitress appeared, she was quick to take our drink orders. The specialty beer right now is a Mango Hef. A pint goes for $4 and the larger one is $5. 

The menu is drastically smaller than the Rampart location, but they do have a few vegetarian friendly dishes. My friend and I ordered a Greek Salad and a Vegetarian Pizza. Our waitress was sweet enough to have the salad split for us with the dressing on the side. The amount that we each got was large. Too bad the dressing was mainly oil. Even after mixing it up, the oil was predominantly what ended up on the salad. The pizza was good. The crust was soggy in certain areas, but that tends to happen with a veggie pizza. The nice chunks of zucchini or squash, onions, tomatoes, mushrooms, and olives gave many different textures. The seasoning that they used on their crust was something we found ourselves wiping up.

Because it was so busy, the staff were not too concern with putting away dishes in a quiet manner. We heard every clank and clunk as dishes were thrown into bus tubs. There were not any refills either or an attempt to check in on us.
Specialty beer is definitely worth a try. Everything else is decent beer. Very good resemblance of Chicago style food like their pizza

Beers were a mix bag, some good, some not (to be expected), service was good, though they goofed on the bill. Chicken strip were very good, above average chicken went into making them, that was clear. Perfectly cooked as well.. Only thing I'd suggest is asking for them to be tossed in the sauce, they serve it drizzled on which leaves some bites with more flavor than others. The teriyaki sauce was extremely sweet as well, more than most I've tried.

A great place to come and enjoy yourself! I have only been to the bar a few times but plan to check out the upstairs soon. The regulars who attend are as much fun and notable as the staff, which are always friendly and nice. I haven't had a bad experience here yet, and the food is always so good!

Is this the only place in Vegas where if you go during happy hour you don't get the happy hour prices if you sit at the bar? But you can move 5 feet away to a table to get the happy hour deals, makes no sense, especially if your gambling. And they only have 3 food items, 10" pizza, garlic knots and pretzel bites. (During happy hour) too many rules! Maybe they should have a flyer with all the restrictions!
Trent the cook made me a pretty delicious breakfast sandwich with home style potatoes at 4 a.m., hit the spot for a late night bite.

Great food. Bartenders are hit and miss.
Brady who is a bartender there is awesome. There is also some Hispanic lady there and it seems like she hates her job. 

People don't go to a bar to just drink. They go to talk to someone and having an impersonal bartender does not go along very well.

For shock factor. Their ghost pepper wings are awesome.
Food is always good and reasonably priced for the area.

Do try their happy hours. Chicken nuggets for $8 during happy hours. Well worth the price.

We came to try this place again, we'd been here a few years ago and brought guests, I don't remember what we ate, it wasn't that impressive, so my husband and I thought we'd try it again.

I was trying to stick with a fairly health meal and I ended up ordering the soldier's cobb salad.  It has chopped tomatoes, egg, smoked bacon, and crumbled blue cheese tossed over mixed greens.  It was a decent size and very fresh.  My husband got the ribs and chicken.  I was able to try a few of the ribs and they were very good.  

Our service was good, the food was decent, since they brew their own beers, it will be something we come back for to try another day.

I live in the neighborhood where this place is located. I used to go there all the time. They USED TO have some really great food but over the past year the food and service have declined horribly to the point where I will never again spend another dime in this place. The last few times I have tried to order food from there they have messed up my order. I ordered a pizza with artichokes and instead they put anchovies on it and no artichokes! It was SO NASTY!!! Also, it looked like they forgot to put the sauce on the pizza and then put it on last minute as the sauce was on the TOP of the cheese! Never seen a pizza like that in my life, or a nastier excuse for a pizza for that matter! Recently I decided to give them another chance and tried to order the meatball sliders. My boyfriend phoned in the order which they took, only to call him back 10 minutes later and tell him that they've taken the meatball sliders off the menu. They couldn't have told him that when he called and ordered it in the first place? Rude & unknowledgeable staff. They recently cut their menu in half, or more. They took everything that was good off! Baked ziti, gone! Quesadilla, gone! Chicken cordon bleu sliders, gone! Meatball sliders, gone! Chicago hotdog, gone! Pot roast, gone! I literally have no reason to ever return to this place again. Way to piss off & lose all your loyal customers Chicago Brewing Co.! Also, I think the old hag, rude, nasty female bartender who bar tends downstairs threw my iphone 6 in the garbage there & claimed that it was never found when I called right after I left! Also, the last time I was inside, I saw the upstairs male bartender (Not Josh) refuse to take a pregnant woman's food order because he was too busy serving hipsters alcohol. This place just doesn't care about it's customers.

We came here for the first time to try out the beer and the service was excellent. We were immediately accommodated and seated on the patio. We ordered an appetizer and a sampler of all 9 beers and they all came within 5 mins of placing our order. The beer sampler was very easy to understand which one we were tasting and the beers exceeded our expectations. The appetizer we ordered was delicious and even being the only people on the patio we were continuously checked on. The manager James was exceptional. He greeted us when we came in and was very friendly, accommodating and even gave us a tour of the building and the beer brewing process. We left with an overwhelming feeling to tell people how great of an experience it was coming here. We will definitely be back again!
The deep dish pizza was awesome, the wings were good, the chicken tenders were really tender, the potatoes skins were some of the best. And the IPA was fantastic.

Three words: Brad, Brady and Jake.  The best bartenders in Vegas.  True story.  The Llyods to my Jack.  Chicago is the Cheers for Vegas.  Everybody knows your name.  They are always glad you came.  

Not only is Chicago Brewing company one of the best zombie apocalypse strongholds in Summerlin,  the food is always on point.  Chipotle ranch 4 lyfe. 

Shout out to Jake for his stellar performance in The Hunger Games as Peeta Mellark

The beers are extremely well done. Would definitely return and sample more of the lineup. They could put a little more effort into the pizza, kind of a half-hearted attempt at Chicago-style. It wasn't bad and I would eat it again but it's not anything I'd get excited about and I can get excited about deep dish.

I have yet to try their pizza.

Great buffalo chicken sliders though. They also run reasonably priced lunch specials which were a great alternative to having to pick between Jack In The Box or Taco Bell during the days I was at Euphoria. They have an awesome happy hour and a vast selection of beer. Oh, and did I mention that their garlic knots are to die for?

Okay, I'll update this with a review of the pizza some other time. 

The Final(ish) Verdict

Pros: 
Great food
Great happy hour specials
Strong drinks
Great service
Steampunk-ish vibe and old-timey ambiance
24 Hours

Cons:
While the service is attentive, they can be slow to get your food to you at times.

Return Factor: 10/10. I still need to try their pizza.

Normally i have an okay time here. My last visit wasnt even okay. 

I didnt even get a chance to eat here and had to leave due to the terrible service. We took a seat at the bar and ordered the deep dish pizza we were craving all diggity day long and a brown ale, along with a couple waters. Then we watched the bartenders behind the bar have internal drama and not even look in our direction as we waited.....and waited........annnnnnd waited. Neither the bar nor the dining area was busy or even half full and i sat for 17 minutes without even the orders for the waters go fulfilled. 
At that point i had seen enough and had to walk out before the food and drinks even arrived. I hated to do it but i could not support the staff and business where that could happen. 

The bottom line is that it was a bad experience but the food i have had here in the past has always been solid, the beer is surprisingly good and priced very well.
We've been here a lot. Food is great and today the potato and bacon soup was ridiculously awesome. I wanted to take a "before" photo but ... Oh well. Gone! Yum.

Usually go for pizza. But this time went for salad,nothing special. And mild wings,naked. Very delicious. Also got chicken tenders. Juicy and big. Very delicious too. Good to know there's other options. A must place to eat while you're in downtown Vegas.

The Chicago style deep dish pizza is to die for! My husband and I agree this is one of the best pizzas we've ever had! We stumbled in here by accident and now we always make a stop here. Feels like a hidden treasure. We actually had it two days in a row.. beats the buffet in quality and flavor. The bread is so soft and doughy. The cheese is so flavorful, you can tell it's top quality.

The look of the building made me feel right at home. We have these types of buildings in the midwest so I was looking forward to the visit.  When we walked in we were advised by the hostess that the upstairs would be a fun place to sit, so we went up there. 

Upstairs There are three small  seating areas, but only small group was there. The  first thoughts I had were that the rug looked like it had seen better days and that table bussing was apparently not a priority. The little bar was crowded with happy people and the bartender was great- wonderful smile, nice personality. 

I didn't find the leather club chairs to be especially comfortable and would have preferred a real table, but overall, it wasn't a bad experience. There were two nice flatscreen TVs showing basketball, which the bar group enjoyed loudly. I loved how the natural light looked, streaming in through the windows and hitting the brick walls. Ah, Ohio...

The food? Meh.  When you serve cheese sauce with beer in it, the beer does not make up for using VELVEETA. Ok? REAL cheese, please. The chips weren't that good either. I was so disappointed. I tried the garlic pretzels and they were good, but more like soft, kosher-salted rolls. My friend's steamed clams did not taste fresh to her, but she thought they were ok.  

I don't know that I would come back here. I don't have anything awful to say about it, but I was underwhelmed during this visit.

Walked in to have 'lunch' sat for 15 minutes before realizing we aren't getting service unless we go to the bar that is full and 'reserved for players' as the bartender put it. We came in good hope again hoping for good service go to the bar and the bartender has shitty attitude about asking what a woman was drinking and said I'm not your father I'm not making decisions for you.. I get it's not up to the bartender but no need for the shitty response because he claims to be having a 'bad' day from lack of sleep. 1/10 lost my business.

Great wings, good pizza, and cheap beer. I don't think you could really go wrong if you came here. 

Also the waitress we had was really nice, we had a ton of leftovers and where about to leave them behind because we where going straight from the restaurant to a bar and didn't want to cart the food around so she offered to put them in a box and leave them for us back behind the counter and even if the place was closed by the tie we came back, she said we could still come in and get our food.

I love this place as a bar, I've stopped going to the restaurant half of it years ago.  The last time I ate a couple slices of their small deep dish pizza, I fell into a food coma, and it ruined my Friday night.  I was so stuffed, that I couldn't move. I suppose I should blame myself, but I wouldn't have eaten so much if their pizza wasn't so damn delicious!

We come here pretty regularly during happy hour.  They have good deals on their house beer, and great deals on their appetizers ($3 garlic knots!)  They have kind of a weird system though, happy hour pricing doesn't apply if you're sitting at the actual bar. You can be IN the bar, but you have to sit at a table.  
There's an awesome deal for girls on Saturdays (I believe it's all day). All vodka based drinks are a dollar, and they pour them strong. Again, be careful where you're sitting.  This deal only applies to patrons sitting in the UPSTAIRS bar.  Don't be scared to order something more complex than a vodka-cran.  Things like melon balls, and electric lemonades are included too!

I've been to Chicago and had pizza, and I've been to a lot of restaurants that advertise Chicago-style pizza. With the exception of one restaurant, that being Chicago Brewing Company in the Four Queens Hotel & Casino, not one of them has actually lived up to the claim of having real Chicago-style pizza.
Fortunately, this is that restaurant, so this is a positive review! They apparently have another location across town, but this is the one I've dined in. Several times, in fact.
The restaurant occupies a little nook in the corner of the Four Queens, and though the prices aren't super-cheap (though you can go across the street to one of the sports bars if dollar-fifty hot dogs are your thing), they're quite fair, and the garlic knots include a surprising amount of sustenance for the price. The beers are apparently brewed at the other location, but they're still local, and they're still delicious. So I recommend them highly.
Get the sampler flight. It's not only eye-catching to have a bunch of wee mugs artfully presented on a two-tiered tray, it's a great way of finding out which of the beers you think you'll like are what you really want to drink, and which beers you weren't sure if you'd like at all are actually a lot better than you'd expected. That's how I found their fruity wheat beer (I think it may have been blueberry), and how we decided what to bring home in a growler.
For the pizza? Get it. It's as close as I've ever found to being real Chicago-style pizza, like I've said before. Reviewers of the other location that are *from Chicago* concur. Maybe it's just not entirely possible to make Chicago-style pizza anywhere but Chicago, but these guys come close and it's delicious to boot. They may have other offerings on the menu, but I never bothered to try because I was so happy to find real Chicago-style pizza.
I feel I've probably not said Chicago-style pizza enough times. Chicago-style pizza. Chicago-style pizza. Chicago-style pizza. There we go.
Anyway, if you like what I keep talking about, then go here. If you've never had Chicago-style pizza (in Chicago or anywhere else), try it here if you're in Vegas. Definitely worth the stop.

Chicago brewing Co is a 24 hour drinking, gaming and late dining place in the Summerlin area. I really love this place. I used to come here often when I lived close and had a late schedule. Nowadays it is few and far between to have days off and late nights. Anyway my favorite thing about this place is that it has freshly brewed beer. The best beer of my life was had here. It was an apricot heffewissen that they brewed in house. And they don't discriminate either- they make beers in all colors and styles so all beer lovers can enjoy this place no matter what your preference.

The next best thing about this place is the staff. I have been coming here over 5 years and in that time they are one of the only restaurants I have ever seen maintain the level of quality in their products and the same staff. That says a lot about a restaurant. The staff is always friendly, on top of things and it doesn't matter when you come. I love that there is always room in the dining area even when it is busy you never feel ignored by he staff here.

Lastly I of course love the food here. Their menu is pretty varied so even if you want something different every time you come, that is possible here. They have everything from thin or thick crust pizza, to burgers, to steak, quesadillas, sandwiches, sweet potato fries and also full entrees and desserts. My favorite meal here is the chicken quesadilla with a side of sweet potato fries and nacho beer cheese! A lot of food but so worth it. I will for sure be back for awesome beer, awesome food and awesome times here.

My husband was in the mood for Chicago Pizza and we didn't want Rosati's, so we grabbed our restaurant.com certificate and jetted to the other side of town.  We didn't expect to get such good food here.  Everything was delicious.

As usual, I didn't go for the pizza.  I love pizza, it just does bad things to my blood sugar, and Chicago Pizza, although tasty, does extra bad things.  I enjoy eating a few bites here and there from my husband so I can get my fix.  In a place like this, I try to reserve my carbs for the beer.

We ordered the following:
The beer sampler - we wanted to try everything so we could decide what we wanted to order (I loved the Weizenheimer and Matt ordered the Black Star Stout)
Brew Wings - Ordered hot, but really weren't hot at all.  They still were crunchy, huge, and just overall yummy.  Some of the best I've had in town.  Instead of celery and blue cheese dressing it had a celery salad which was really cool, crisp and refreshing and I loved it.  Very creative and original.
Baby Brew Salad - I ordered this with a Balsamic Reduction Vinaigrette.  For a side salad this was huge, fresh and delicious.
Deep Dish Meat Lovers Pizza - Matt substituted garlic for Canadian Bacon, not sure why he doesn't like Canadian Bacon since it is just essentially ham!  The whole time he was eating this all he could say was "wow, this is so good."  He was very very happy with the pizza here and this might be his favorite.

I'm not sure how often we'll go here since it is, as I said, not really near where we live.  But with our restaurant.com certificate it was only $20 bucks for all this food and beer which was a bargain.  I am tempted to try the ghost pepper wings on the menu but I am a little scared.  However, with the regular hot wings being so mild I am thinking that they will be mild as well.  I shall have to work myself up to it next time. 

Oh by the way, the beer is wonderful!  Nice to find a place in town that has the beer towers again after The Pub at Monte Carlo stopped serving them.

Very nice place, clean bar area. Its located in 4 queens, kind of hidden though, in the corner of the casino, where you have to walk up stairs. I honestly wouldnt have known about this place had it not been for the reviews on Yelp.

The bad: Not exactly bad, but I wasn't all that impressed with their deep dish. Ive been to Chicago on several occasions, and while I dont know about their regular pizza, the deep dish doesnt taste anywhere remotely close to Chicago. Still good though, and for 10 bucks, not much to complain about. If it was $15 or more, I'd be ticked.

The good: The happy hour. FANTASTIC!!!! Its Mon-Fri from 3-6pm, all apps 1/2 price. The apps were just straight up awesome. I had the wings, calamari, and chicken tenders. Ate the first 2, boxed the last to have later as a snack.  They also had $3 in house beers, but I dont drink beer, so no review there.

Overall, a nice little diamond in the rough. Wasn't crowded, service was good, food was great. Will definitely come back for their happy hour when I visit Vegas again.

Our group of 4 stopped in here this past Friday night because we were all craving pizza. Found a spot to sit in a back corner, and we were greeted pretty quickly. Waiter was friendly and attentive considering they were pretty packed and quickly brought us drinks. We had garlic knots, mozzarella sticks and two 16" pizzas and had quite a bit of pizza leftover. Everything was delicious! I've never seen so many pepperonis on a pizza in my life. Prices were extremely fair, too.

Lived in Vegas for years and have never been here. Finally getting the chance thanks to Sin City Brew Tours. Enjoying a relaxing evening with friends and love the designated driver! The beers are good and the atmosphere is fun. Stop by with friends.

Among the many...and I mean many.. bartenders in this amazing city, Bob stands among the best. The Man knows his beer and his football, as well. Bartender Kimmie is amazing, too...as is Tiffany...as is Mike...and don't get me started on the kick ass kitchen crew. Two thumbs way UP!!!!

The food is incredible, service is really good also. The waitress was very knowledable with the menu and was very polite. The deep dish pizza is definitely worth it, I have no problem going back there again for food. Anytime the food and service is top notch then it's a must to return.

Their garlic cheese knots were to die for! LOVED them! They beers were just OK. Their homemade Root Beer was very tasty. The only bad things I would say about this place: my grandfather was in a wheelchair & due to it's 2nd floor location, it was tricky to get to - we had to go up the elevator & through another restaurant to get to it. Also there is limited seating. One side is smoking section & the other is non smoking both are very small. Visiting this place was definitely worth it for the Root Beer & the Cheese Knots. The pizza was just OK.

Not really a true brewery... It's a small room inside the 4 Queens. The "brewery" is offsite 7 miles away. 
As a home brewer the beers were nothing I couldn't make at home myself... Maybe I should talk to 4 Queens and I could get a brewery! LOL
Unless you just want to check another "brewery" off your list... Not really worth checking out.

This review is only for beer and cigars at the Chicago Brewing Company.  We stopped in here a couple weeks ago and sat at the bar.  The bartender was super friendly and helpful.  I had the beer sampler (see pic) and all the beers were delicious.  Each one seemed to accurately represent that particular style of brewing.  My favorites were the Ramblin Reck Amber Ale, the Old Town Brown and the IPA.  I also smoked a great cigar at the bar.  The food coming out of the kitchen looked great and next time I'll definitely eat.  The beer was really outstanding and so was the service.  Chicago Brewing Company is located on the second floor of Four Queens.  I've been in the casino many times and never seen the restaurant until the day we went there.  The ambiance is typical neighborhood bar...very comfortable and casual.  I'll be back at here every time I'm in the downtown area.  Beer-5 stars, Service-4 stars, Ambiance-3 stars, Value-5 stars, Food-no rating.
try the beer...quad damn it...went home with a growler of it last night...

Have been customers for many years. Last night we went there for dinner and discovered a "new menu". In short, all the entrees have been removed! Now it's just typical "bar food". Too bad. We won't be returning.

Head upstairs for a quiet and frendly experience.  Brad does a great job of making new visitors feel welcome.  Cosy seating areas as well as small intimate bar area.
GREAT chicken strips.  Try things out during happy hour with good in house beers.

Sunday nights, I don't get out of work until 10 PM. Like many towns, there's not a lot open around 11ish unless you want to pay exorbitant prices on the Strip, or eat fast food. 

Well on Sunday, 4/17/11, Lawrence T., came to see the show I work for and afterward, we were in search of some food. Having missed out on Ken M.'s UYE "Pizzas, Peppers & Pints" and living too far away to come here by myself, I was dying to try this place because they serve Ghost Peppers and luckily, it's right around the corner from Lawrence's apartment, so that's where we ended up going.

It was a ghost town when we walked in. There was one person in one booth when we walked on in. We were seated right next to the kitchen. I was torn when I saw the menu. "Chicken fingers in ghost pepper sauce or ribs." It was a tough choice because I'd been dying for ribs for a good week now, and to add insult, my parents had went to Lucille's BBQ earlier that day with my youngest siblings and brought my sister and me back nada. The pull for BBQ was too strong, and I ordered the ribs and fries ($19), and Lawrence ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich ($10)  topped with breaded onion strings, and macaroni salad.

We didn't have to wait too long for our meal to be delivered to us. The food runner switched our plates and seemed a bit surprised that no, the meat was my order. My ribs were good, but not fall off the bone. They weren't the Memphis Dry Rub ribs that I love so much, they were smothered in some sort of BBQ sauce. I regret not trying the Ghost Pepper... anything because common sense tells me I can eat BBQ anywhere. Lawrence took half his sandwich home for the next day but I assume he liked it.

Our bill came out to $31.35 with tax, which is a little steep for late night food, but that's my fault for ordering ribs. Would I be back, eh... only if I'm for sure going to order something with the Ghost Pepper, otherwise, nah.

I don't get down to Fremont Street as much as I did in the past. Let's face it, depending on when you go, the area can be quite sketchy. When I do get down there though, Chicago Brewing is one of the main reasons for it. The staff has always been great, and the beers really good, especially on a hot Vegas day or night.

I really like the pizza, and they do have plenty of other items other than pizza. But, those garlic knots with marinara sauce are the bomb. Put a plate of those in front of me with a tall one, and I'm a happy camper. The place is small, but i think that's part of the charm of it. It would loose some of the allure to me if it was any bigger. Prices are decent as well.

If you like good food, good beer, friendly people, then you're at the right place. But damn, get you some of those garlic knots.

This place was a good place to go for a little snack. We both got a side salad and our own order of wings. The wings were a big portion, and we even took some home. The salad was nothing great, iceburg lettuce a couple grape tomatoes. They are famous for their Bloody Mary menu, and my husband loved it. We always stay at the Four Queens so it was convenient. They have TV, all sports related.

Drinks & appetizers review only 

Decent beer.  The pours are extremely nice here.  You can buy a pitcher of IPA for $20, or a 32 Oz for $13.  We got the pitcher.

The IPA is decent.  It's really a standard IPA.  No complaints about it.  I'd say it's on par w/ BJ's Brewery.

TIPS:
-Located in the "4-Queens" Casino in Fremont area
-Inside is pretty old T
-There are lots of TV's inside

If I could give zero stars I would!!!!! I ordered chicken wings and they were pink on the inside so I told my server she said she was going to go to the cook so they can recook them so she did and brought them back out meanwhile my lunch break was over so I had to take them to go a few hours later I try to eat them again and they were still pink. I then went back to talk to the manager and he was the rudest person I've ever met in my life!!! He tried to tell me that All chicken is pink on the inside, when have you ever ate a piece of chicken that is pink on the inside???!!!! That means it is not cooked fully. I am pregnant and I can't be eating raw chicken and get salmonella. Worst customer service ever I will never be going back there and my life!!! Don't give them any of your money!
Awesome food! Pizza is great!! I recommend the thin crust. Very crispy, perfect amount of toppings and tasty. Friendly, fast service. Highly recommended.
Chicago deep dish doors not even come close to Gino's or Giordano's. The happy hour specials are awesome. highly recommend the filet sliders.
I love a good IPA and the Chicago Brew Co has a good one. Albiet a small bar its big on taste and I opt for the sliders and an IPA when I go and leave fat and happy.
You had me at: "Beer brewed onsite", "beer garden", "open 24 hours", "we cut our own chicken tenders and make the batter here", "the posole was made this morning" and "can I get you another one".

Awful -- we walked out.  We had hoped to enjoy Happy Hour here but after 10+ minutes, no greeting, no server, no nothing.  We asked at the bar and were told to "Have a seat; someone will come over."  No apology, nothing.

Life is too short. We walked out and went to Lazy Dog who appreciated our business very much.

We took a friend out to eat here for his birthday dinner because we wanted something that was "nice" but also "kid friendly" since he wanted to spend some time with our 2-year-old. Clearly, he doesn't have kids or he wouldn't have said this.
 
It turns out, our server was awesome, the food and drinks came out fast. But hold the phone.. The cinnamon knots for dessert were out of this world!!! Made fresh and served hot, they melt in your mouth, not in your hands! I think I might even pop in some time just to order that and nothing else. 

While I am not, if you are a beer person, this is the place for you! The 2 men I was with thoroughly enjoyed "beer hopping" brews they would normally not have the opportunity to try elsewhere. And I happily sipped my glass of red wine, while my son happily enjoyed his milk.
Place has been here forever. I never bothered to try it until tonight. Dinning room was closed had to eat in smoke filled bar....... But wow was the food good. Fresh and tasty.
Deep dish pizzas are small but will definitely fill you up. The food was awesome but the restaurant was small. However I would go back for sure when I'm in Las Vegas.
Upstairs bar is way better.  Great bar staff.  Quick service.  Cheap beer and wine.

Stopped by here on a lazy Monday afternoon with a buddy of mine.   The place was easy to find and it was about half full which was surprising for a Monday afternoon around 1.   We were greeted and shown to a table.   We looked over the beer selection which was pretty decent, but we wanted to try the stuff they brewed.   We both ended up ordering the IPA.  It was good, it had a nice bitterness to it.   Since we really weren't that hungry, we ordered some steak fries to snack on.   Those were pretty good.   It was a good match for the beer.   

Overall, this is a nice place to go.   Will I be back?   Yeah, probably, but I need to see more of what's around first.

Beer was ok, but the in house root beer was fantastic - give it a shot. The food was ok, but certainly one of the better options Freemont and the prices were right. 

Our waiter was very pleasant. Was not swooned by the place, but I'd return if I was in the area.

This was possibly one of the worst places I've eaten at based on the service and lackluster food. While you can see the wait staff walking around the restaurant constantly, don't expect them to check in too often. Repeatedly through out our meal, my boyfriend had to flag down people that were servicing other tables because our waitress was nonexistent. I wanted to split my meal with my boyfriend and no extra dish was given to do so. We ordered a pasta dish but, it was so bland we didn't finish it. At the end of the meal, due to our party size, we were charged an 18% gratuity. I can't justify 18% gratuity when I saw our waitress once to take our orders and a second time to disperse our meal. We also waited a tremendous amount of time for our meal (45 minutes). After all that waiting, our food was lukewarm/room temperature when it got to the table.

Pizza is pretty good, service not so much. Mellow mood on a Sunday afternoon during football season. Deep dish pizza is super saucy which I loved. Too bad it's the second time I've been here and service fell short both times ... don't think I'll come back.

Great beer here, and a better atmosphere to boot.  I ventured out to this place and was quite impressed with the beer offerings that they had.  I had the Black Star Stout, the Hardway IPA and the All Nighter and all of them were stellar.  For dinner I had the Cajun pasta, which I would highly recommend to anyone.  The guy sitting next to me at the bar, who appeared to be a regular, told me the deep-dish pizzas here were stellar, but since I was a party of one I thought that a whole deep dish would be too much my waistline.  The rest of the menu appeared to be standard brewery fare with a solid selection of pastas, pizza, sandwiches, burgers and appetizers.

The atmosphere of this place was kinda nice.  Downstairs had a enclosed smoking area bar (where I learned the bartenders can take your food order but not deliver it to your table due to smoking laws; they leave you food right outside the section, tell you it's ready and you have to get it yourself) complete with many TVs, and there was an upstairs section as well that had a Golden Tee machine and a cigar lounge.  There also was a normal dining area and a patio as well.

Service in the smoking area of the bar was a bit slow, as the bartenders seemed a bit preoccupied by the girls at the end of the bar rather than my empty beer glass, but I can't really blame them too much since the girls were hot.

Great food, great beer, great atmosphere.  Hit his place up if you are ever in the area.

I spent a few hours here today and must say I was impressed. 

The food once ordered was top notch, delivered fast, was plentiful and was fresh and tasty.

I sat upstairs at the Bar with a few local/regular patrons and they were both inviting and great to talk to about current events and most importantly micro brews.

I love heff beers and theirs was pretty darn good. When I commented on the color and taste the bar tender I believe his name was Max was happy to share his extensive knowledge on the subject.

Its a pretty far drive from home but if Im in the area I will be happy to stop in and have a great brew, great food and great company.

I really would give this place four stars if it wasn't for the fact they allow smoking in the bar. Cigars too, which I guess is a selling point with them. I was under the impression that a bar that serves food in Nevada couldn't have smoking, but I guess not here. It's too bad really because the food is good, the beer was awesome, and the bartenders were friendly, but ultimately I couldn't take noxious cigar smoke from other patrons wafting over my food. Just a thing to keep in mind if you're a non-smoker.

Was here for Small Business Saturday, and scored a giant pint glass for $10. A decent price, and for $15 they will fill it with a cold one.
The bar area is typical poker bar chic (I use that term loosely) and is relatively inviting. Chicago Brewing usually has some unique flavors on tap, and I was pleased to enjoy a Coconut Porter. This one deserves kudos, the coconut was not too prevalent but was definitely there. I haven't had their food in a while, and ran out of time to get some garlic knots or pizza. Outdoor seating is available too.

Everything is good in this restaurant.  I love it so much, but their salads in particular are the best in all the valley.  I think its because they're plentiful and just plain delicious!  Beer and wine offerings are always very impressive.  This place is great for kids or even a casual date.  Or a girls date night.  Enjoy this locals spot in vegas.

The mango habanero wings are fuego  Great drinking snack. Not spicy like the name implies. I also had their guava beer and it was great! Not too sweet, and definitely for people that don't like strong beers.

YUCK, YUCK, and MORE YUCK, or is it YUM, YUM, YUM?

If you are a smoker, especially an excessive one...you just may like this place.  A little mini-casino, but mainly a bar with food.  Horrible ventilation, so you walk into a complete and utterly thick and smelly fog.

For the rest of us, the non-smokers -- no way no how.

in my opinion, pizza & beer is kinda hard to mess up, but this place is really, really good.  i'm  a fan of Chicago's Lou Malnatis and this place is almost as good.  if you can't fly to Chicago for pizza, then definitely enjoy the pizza here.

Nice spot to meet up wit frenz & chill out...They got the upstairs 4 folks 2 get loud...Family area downstairs, if U got the kids...Amy & I went 2 this joint & thru down a few beers...DAMN!!!  Took us a memorable glass home 2...Food is aight...I-candy, 4 sho...

Gambling at the bar was ignored by the bartenders and staff the people their right now 9/3/17 should all be let go I can't believe how terrible this place is and I will reflect it to all my guest downtown

So yah, here I go with yet another Groupon-related review!

I have wanted to check out this location for a while. Honestly, if I'm in the area I'm usually too tempted by some of the other restaurants to check this place out, but I'm glad I finally took the plunge.

I came with my two fellas for some burgers and beer. I ordered the Bar Brew-Q Burger, as did my main fella and my friend Ryan B ordered the Chili Burger. I was very happy with my food. Huge, I'll definitely be doing some sharing next time I'm there. The burger was moist, flavorful and cooked perfectly. Great price for the quantity and quality. 

To top that glutton fest off, we couldn't resist some delectably indulgent deep-fried treats. We ordered the deep-fried ho ho, honey bun and caramel apple (I refuse to type carmel, lol). They were interesting options and I was quite happy with the choices. I liked the honey bun and apple the best, but I definitely would suggest sharing at this place. 

The beers are great too. Tasty and they go well with the pub grub. We'll definitely be checking this place out more regularly.

Pizza and beer. A match made in heaven. I've been hearing some great word of mouth about this place for ages and have been dying to try it. Finally, I got my chance. 

I ordered the white pizza and a hef. The garlicky goodness was so badass. I love when white pizza is done right. It's a hard trick, but they pull it off flawlessly. The beer is fantastic as well. I'm psyched to try their rootbeer on my next trip. It looked so refreshing, 

There are quite a few other menu items that caught my eye as well, so I look forward to my next visit there. It'll definitely be sooner than later. I'll have to add this to my regular rotation in town. 

Love it.

Oh Chicago, it pains to me to write this bad review. I was a frequent customer, my husband was a huge fan of this restaurant. But they had to change. They removed the happy hour on the dining room and they changed the menu. 

Tonight me and my family went to eat dinner, I ordered a cream of mushroom soup which was way way way too salty and peppery. Our burgers was OK, but the most disappointing item was the chocolate cake. Oh the cake! Haha it costed us $7 for a small chocolate cake drown in chocolate syrup, not ganache with a pitiful scoop of ice cream. The ice cream was so small. I am getting my cake from cheesecake factory next time!!

The server didn't even fill our empty water, and the host didn't say anything when we are leaving, sorry chicago, we will never go back
Get off the beaten path and try this place out!  Great food, great service and reasonable prices.  A must to try is the blackened chicken quesadilla.

I've been here twice. The first time, we sat up in the loft area.  There was a pungent overpowering smoke odor and I just felt like I wanted to shower as soon as I got home to get the smell out of my hair.  We sat at a table and one of us had to get up each time and order pitchers at a time since it took awhile to get drinks.

The second time, I sat with a few friends at the tables on the first floor by the fireplace.  The service was extremely slow and I realized after awhile it was because the main bartender was also running around grabbing table orders too.  I'm not sure if that's usually how it is, but that definitely caused a delay in service.  Again, we'd preemptively order a couple drinks at once to hold us over until he came back around.

Don't ask why, but I ordered the ahi tuna salad. At a bar. Hmm.  It was actually pretty okay though.  Too much salad to tuna ratio, but it was okay.  I wouldn't order it again though.  The general agreement from my other friends about the food was that it was okay.

If I was rating just beer, I would give this place 4 stars.  They have a house blueberry vanilla kinda beer that is really yummy.  Their house beers are good and I'd go back for that alone.  I really like their house blonde, it's light and tasteful.  But the service is just terrible and the food is just okay. And they don't have that famous big glass drink thing they used to that I've heard people talk about (sorry for the ambiguity since I've never actually seen it).
